headline: Been there did it.
content: Live band..on a Wed. night, yawn. Table up front. check. Drinks for two..check.  Next location, I'm sorry wait, pay the bill. $29 for two drinks. Been there did it.

headline: Have a Drink Here !
content: My first time in Key West and Sloppy Joe's was New Year's Eve 1972, the joint was hopping that night , packed with party people, and someone inside calls my name. We closed the place that night! Of course time has past, there are more...More

headline: Expensive tourist trap
content: We chose to join the hype & go to Sloppy Joe's for drinks while watching a trio of has been musicians. They did a few songs then took an extended break next door with their libations. The 2 souvenir cups with drinks & an added...More

headline: Great food and fun
content: Stopped in for lunch. The atmosphere was lively and fun.  Group ordered philly cheese, blackened chicken, chili dog and of course the Sloppy Joe.  Everything was outstanding.  A fun place to people watch, listen to the music and enjoy some great food.

headline: Sloppy Joe's Bar
content: If you've "never" been to Sloppy Joe's it's great!  The first time atmosphere and nuance's are appealing.  But, if you've been to Sloppy Joe's more than 2/3 times it's more of the same.

headline: A must
content: We were told that we must stop at Sloppy Joe's.  It was a very fun experience.  Food and service was excellent.  We had a late lunch off the appetizer menu, but had lots of food!  Drinks were good too...but rather expensive.  We also enjoyed the...More

headline: Friendly Staff, ok food.
content: We visited for a couple cold beers and food. The bartenders were switching when we were in the middle of our meal, but they were both friendly. The beer was cold, but the food was kinda gross. We ordered the roast beef sandwich which was...More

headline: Great fun
content: You can't go to Key West without stopping into Sloppy Joe's. Take some time to look at the pictures and memorabilia on the walls and ceilings, there is some really neat stuff there. The food is reasonably priced and tasty bar food. The bands are...More

headline: Neat place with great Hemmingway History
content: Sloppy Joe's is a neat place as far as Hemmingway history. It is neat inside with pictures, atmosphere, and a band. The food was kinda high but we found all the food is pricey for what you get in Key West. They are known for...More

headline: A must stop when in Key West
content: The atmosphere is very friendly and the beer is ice cold.  The day we were there they had live entertainment which was really good.  We actually had lunch and we thought everything was delicious.  We would go there again next time

headline: A must do!
content: Sloppy Joe's was our first stop in Key West after checking in to our hotel. It was definitely the best way to kickoff our vacation! We shared the nachos with sloppy joe; it was delicious! Their signature margarita and the lemonade cocktail were amazing!!! It...More

headline: Not as cool as you want it to be!
content: The food is OK. It's very loud and crowded. It's a good venue to see new or younger bands. Fun for younger kids if you are in the area. Kind of a required stop for a T-shirt.

headline: Fun
content: A great way to spend lunch time while it's raining.  Fun music, good food, seat yourself and a Manager from Wisconsin who nailed it on Customer Service!!!

headline: atmosphere
content: The food was good and the atmosphere was good, not a five but  a good place if you want a couple drinks with the tourist. Wait staff just kind of seem like they want to get you in an out.

headline: Fun Place to Eat
content: The seating was a little difficult, because you have to seat yourself.  The food was delicious and the entertainment was really good.  Wait staff were courteous and checked on us frequently to see if we needed refills on drinks or anything to make our meal...More

headline: Sloppy Joe's
content: This place is good for the tee shirts and shot glasses. Did not eat any food there. Was also site of the Hemingway Look-A-Like contest.

headline: Good food/Great entertainment
content: Went to Sloppy Joe's for lunch and had great food.  Went there in the evening for drinks and listened to an outstanding band.  Everyone in my group enjoyed themselves day and night.

headline: Womp.
content: Good live music and decent atmosphere. The food was...eh. We ordered the "signature" Sloppy Joe sandwich, which I've honestly had better from a can of Manwich. And our waitress wasn't the best. I mean, it was so hard to track her down, and even asking...More

headline: The place to be!
content: My husband and I love this place! We have enjoyed the service, food, and the music. Hats off to our server, Laura.  She is amazing!

headline: Fun place!
content: Big place, better than expected.  Busy of course, but no problem getting a table to cool off from the heat.  Drinks were cold and tasty.  Live music.  Everyone needs a Sloppy Joe's t-shirt!

headline: Great Time
content: This is one of my favorites places in the country.  I spend hours at a time listening to music and enjoying the entertainment.   I have driven from Miami to Key West just to spend a few hours at Sloppy Joe's

headline: Must go....
content: Yes, icon of Key West.  Yes, touristy bar.  Yes,  very good food and very good drinks.  We stopped in more than once.  The Sloppy Rita is really tasty!

headline: Great Place!
content: Great food and great vibe in the whole place! loved it! It had a very welcoming atmosphere, very laid back. Loved listening to the live music.

headline: Atmosphere atmosphere atmosphere
content: Sit at the bar.  Have a mango mojito on the rocks!  And be sure and ask for Les is more!  He is a true joy and made the whole trip into the bar for us.  Great crab cakes and conch fritters!

headline: Just ok
content: We stopped in on a sweltering busy saturday afternoon to grab a bite and were a party of 6. Didnt have a problem finding a table, as its seat yourself. Our waitress seemed busy but made her way over to us taking our drink orders...More

headline: Keep walking!
content: We tried a few times to get a table as one of my friends badly wanted to eat at sloppy joe's. We finally walked in and got a seat for lunch the thursday we left. Over rated!!! My two friends each got the original sloppy...More

headline: A piece of history, pretty fun, but not great
content: We had to go to Sloppy Joe's during our week-long vacation to Key West, and I'm glad we did, but I can't help feeling a little disappointed. The food and drinks were good, if not memorable, and the atmosphere was fun, but it's so loud...More

headline: A big come-on
content: Our waitress went very sour when we placed 1/2 our order at a time (Sloppy Joe was excellent, as was the salad).  Saving grace, for those of us who found the waitress such a turn-off that we decided not to eat, was the atmosphere +...More

headline: Great place
content: Not our first time in Key West or Sloppy Joes but we went there 3 times during our visit Great food,great live music and very friendly staff Got asked if I was there for the Earnest Hemingway lookalike contest ! Must have a shave before...More

headline: Drunkards Delight
content: Maybe it was all the spring breakers but everyone was just plain 'sloppy' drunk. The food is typical greasy bar food that will just add to the Hemmingway belly and send you on your way running to the lavatory. BUT, if you want a unique...More

headline: Great live Music and Friendly Staff
content: What can I say?  Sloppy Joe's is an institution in and of itself...there is no other place like it in the world.  Friendly Staff and great sloppy joes.  Moderately priced.

headline: A must see
content: This is a great place to visit. We had the Sloppy Joe's for dinner one night. We enjoyed the people watching and the music was great. This is open air and full of people with first come, first served tables. Be prepared to walk around...More

headline: Worth eating here, but that's all
content: The only reason we ate here was because Ernest Hemingway spent a lot of time in the original one here on the key. The food is OK, ambiance is OK, service is good, but it is nothing special other than its notoriety. There are better...More

headline: Mmm-mmm
content:
Nice servers and good food. This is a super, super, super popular place and it's obvious why.

They have nice servers and live musicians playing while you eat.

Just be weary if you don't like crowds.

headline: Famous bar food not so good
content: We stopped in for lunch and  ordered a few appetizers . The conch fritters were doughy and cold so we sent it back ,the chicken wings were extremely small and just ok , get bigger wings people , but the tossed salad was actually very...More

headline: Hemingway Look Alike Weekend
content: We spent Friday afternoon at Sloppy Joe's and had a wonderful time.  It was the second elimination contest and it was just fun seeing all the 'look-alikes' of Hemingway throughout different years of his life (including some who did not look like him at all!)....More

headline: Good food, great atmosphere!
content: Had some food and a few drinks here, had the original sloppy joe sandwich and the conch fritters - both highly recommended! The atmosphere is great, there's always a band on and it's always busy. The service was quick and it was good value for...More

headline: Good Drinks and Entertainment
content: Sloppy Joe's has one of the best band stands of all the bars in Key West. You can really have a good time and not feel like your in a closet in this bar. Since it is bigger with high ceilings, it just doesn't seem...More

headline: A must stop if only to say I have been there
content: Each time we go to Key West-about 6 times-we have to stop and have lunch here-tradition-reminds me of The Red Dog Saloon in Juneau ,Alaska-loud music, good beer and acceptable food which is a must visit if in town-

headline: Fun fun fun...
content: Of course we had a blast at the Hemingway Days celebration at Sloppy Joe's!  My only complaint was a very rude, older male bartender that was working the smaller bar that's located behind the stage area.  Everyone was so nice and friendly, except that blond...More

headline: Who knew....
content: Ok I've lived in FL almost all my life, and coming to the Keys for a long time. Was always told to have the burgers at Sloppy Joe's. Well this time I actually looked at the menu...go figure!  They have sloppy joe's and they are...More

headline: Great evening
content: The band was great playing current hits and favorites  as were the drinks. Service was quick an accurate as well as pleasant. Recommend

headline: Fun
content: We didn't go to eat, but went to dance...3x during our week.  Each time was more fun than the prior.  Great bands and plenty of room for dancing.

headline: Best band!!
content: I went on a Friday night with my husband and friends. It was busy but room to walk. We say at the bar with a perfect view of the amazing band. I didn't want to leave!!

headline: Had to visit
content: No visit to Key West is complete without stopping at Sloppy Joe's. The place was crowded but not overcrowded. Our drinks were served right away. I had the hot dog with the Sloppy Joe mix. It was just okay. My son had a wrap and...More

headline: Great food
content: Sloppy joe was the best. We tried the sloppy fries and they were very good. We went in the early evening before the band really got going and the noise level was tolerable.

headline: Great live music!
content: A Monday noon time ..love music..great atmosphere! All the doors were open, fans blowing, loving the breezes of Key West!

headline: Guess what excellent sloppy Joe's!
content: We stopped on a day trip to Key West to try out sloppy Joe's. They had a very  varied menu but we tried out the sloppy Joe's which were excellent. It was very busy but we received prompt and good service; I would recommend.

headline: A little touristy but then, hey, it is Duval Street
content: Yes, if you are on Duval St. you need to stop by and pay homage to Sloppy Joes. A trip to Key West is not complete with such a stop. The band was great, the service was friendly and the beer cold. I was pleasantly...More

headline: Been there done that
content: Was warned that this place wasn't anything special. We went just to say we did. Sloppy joe to eat was good. Very loud.

headline: good fun
content: food was okay good atmosphere live music  a little loud but okay not a long wait time at all slopppy joe is very sloppy but that is what they are famous for

headline: Best bar for Hemingway nostalgia
content: Loved this place. Full of Hemingway nostalgia. Drinks and food are very good. Atmosphere is even better. All open air and great gift shop attached.

headline: Good Dining - great entertainment
content: We had lunch here and it was pretty good.  Serving portion was a bit on the large side but manageable.  Good value for price and very good service.  Overall atmosphere was quite enjoyable too.

headline: Good food but LOUD
content: We traveled as a group of 7 and were seated at a table for 5. Our server came over and quickly added a table and we comfortably ate at a table for 8. Our server was great and our food was too. At the time...More

headline: What a great bar, check it out bet you go back a second time
content:
Loads of buzz in Duval Street  Key West.
But this bar you have to check out.
It's GREAT
Bar staff are on the ball all the time drinks flow
Live music your not wanna leave

headline: It is a classic
content: You have to go to Sloppy Joe's if you are in KW, specially go around the corner to the old Sloppy to know more about the style and history of Key West.

headline: Stop by to say you've been!!
content: You don't come here for a good meal.  You come to see where Hemingway hung out....  You come for cold drinks and to party!  So come and have a drink....  Buy a t-shirt and have a good story to tell!

headline: Fun time. Decent food!
content: We didn't go to this place at first due to the mediocre reviews but it was a great atmosphere and after going to Hemingway House, I was glad we had gone there since Hemingway hung out there (he was quite the partier!) the food was...More

headline: Nights of rocking out & cold drinks !
content: Had a great time Sunday & Monday night rocking out and dancing,( as best we can at 58), to ENCORE from Texas ! All our lady servers did a great job of keeping me and my wife cooled off with cold whiskey and beer. It...More

headline: Very good!
content: We only got sandwiches but they were delicious!  Blackened grilled chicken was awesome and the pulled pork was really good as well!  The atmosphere is great live music all the time open air but still air conditioned.  I will definitely go there again next time...More

headline: A must see venue when visiting Key West
content: My wife and I visited Sloppy Joes on our recent visit to Key West ( June 2014). Friends from England had strongly recommended the bar for its ambiance, friendliness and more importantly good cold beer and excellent bar food!! We were not disappointed we called...More

headline: Don't expect top cuisine, enjoy the atmosphere
content: Nice and "need to see" bar on Key West. Relaxed and informal, nice snacks and drinks, no more and no less. Probably you will love it or will hate it. If you expect neat and tidy restaurant style: don't go. If you want a nice...More

headline: Cold Draft and Soccer on TV
content: Sloppy Joe's small air conditioned bar, is attached to the main bar and very comfortable for enjoying a cold draft ale while munching on food and enjoying sports; this time soccer.  Great bartender (Jordan) and friendly customers in a cozy and comfortable environment.

headline: OK at best
content: Stopped by for a quick lunch, huge ‚Äòok‚Äô meals, live entertainment, party like atmosphere. Certainly looks like the popular place to be! If you want pub style food & loud music then this is for you. If not Im sure there are plenty of other...More

headline: not really worth it.
content:
I know it is a noteworthy place, but the service was rushed and rude.  
I was not impressed by the attitude of the whole place that made me feel like I was lucky to be there paying them for beers.

headline: Pricey, but a must see
content:
We went with 3 adults and bought a sloppy joes each,
2 cokes and a sloppy rita.
Set us back USD50 
Music was live and amusing but really loud.

headline: Going downhill!
content:
Loved this place last time we were in key west, struggling to get a table! This time there were plenty of seats to be had, the music was terrible until a young girl came on stage and cheered everyone up! 

Service wasn't great and the...More

headline: Sloppy Rita Super!
content: On a hot afternoon in Key West this was a perfect pit stop to wet the whistle with a Sloppy Rita, which was awesome and great live music too!  Will be back next time!

headline: We enjoyed our visit
content: Sure it's a big tourist attraction destination, but the food and beverages were very good and the place has a vibe that is very cool. You need to make this a stop on your journey around Key West!

headline: AWFUL!!!!!
content: Went to this restaurant as I read many good reviews so thought id give it a try,  and how badly i regret making this choice.  This place was simply terrible from start to finish.  Very bad service,  no greeting at all.  Gave wrong order and...More

headline: Dont waste your time
content: A fun environment,  but the food was gross and the drinks were terrible. With so many good and fabulous other places to eat I wouldn't waste my time here ever again.

headline: Good food and entertainment
content: Always a favorite since coming to the Keys since 2005. This time I tried their original Sloppy Joe and it was excellent. Live entertainment always playing after 9 pm. A large selection of choices for all appetites.

headline: Fun Experience!
content: We enjoyed a fun lunch at Sloppy Joe's.  The musician was excellent, and the fare was good drinks and excellent bar food.  The place was crowded, appropriately historic, and high energy.  If you go you must have the sloppy joe sandwich with fries ... it's...More

headline: So Much Fun!
content: We visited Sloppy Joes a couple of times while we were here.  Once in the afternoon for happy hour and then back another nite for drinks and fun.  This place has such a great vibe and is really super fun!  Everyone is enjoying themselves, the...More

headline: Still a favorite
content: Before Sunset stop by and get a beer, drink & Sloppy's Joe 10 " Pizza fills up 2 pretty quick. Then head on over to MallorySquare about 7:00pm to get set for a beautiful Sunset>Take someone you care about with you to enjoy

headline: Fun Atmosphere anytime of the day or week!
content:
When you first walk into this crowded bar & eatery you kind of look around and say cooool!
Little did we know its  historical significance and all it had to offer.
Ernest Hemingway spent allot of time belly up to the bar in this establishment...More

headline: Must stop on your 'Duval crawl'
content: This is really the end of the road.  No really, drive as far as you can and this is where you end up.  Best place to visit in the keys, and a final destination for a 'Duval crawl'.  The food is good, the drinks are...More

headline: Great smoked fish dip!
content: Good music, lively atmosphere, and now they serve craft beers...had a Cigar City Cracker Ale....good!

headline: Great music venue
content: Good foods, great drinks and fantastic bands can be found at Sloppy Joe's.  I'm always happy when I can catch the Doerfels playing Sloppy Joe's when I'm visiting Key West.  Their a great family band.  This is one of the "hot spots" of Key West.

headline: Just what we needed
content: Just what we needed on a hot and humid day in KW. Cold beer for me and a coke for my wife in a nice cool joint called Sloppy Joe's

headline: Good Food, Live Entertainment
content: We were here with another couple for dinner/drinks our first night in Key West - had the fish tacos and they were very good.  Everyone enjoyed their meal.  This is an old bar in Key West, well known and kind of a landmark - from...More

headline: Nostalgia
content: Apart from being a great bar it served up the best chicken wings I have ever tasted - also there was a singer/guitarist which gave the place a lovely atmosphere

headline: Bar Stop
content: Great music and service!  They had the University Of Alabama Flag hanging!  Roll Tide!!  Other schools too but none better!

headline: Well worth the stop
content: The iconic Key West bar and eatery. Been many times, never disappointed. No matter for lunch, dinner, or a late night snack, always good always entertaining. The standard that all Key West bars/restaurants should strive for.

headline: Interesting
content: Place was packed, but service was fast. Drinks were good and the Sloppy Joe burger was good!  Fun place to hang out.

headline: Fun times and good food!
content: The mainstay sloppy joe is delicious.  Live music and cold beer makes this place a must stop for anyone in Key West!!!!!!!

headline: Key West Lemonade!
content: Perfectly situated on Duval street in the center of Key West's bars and restaurants, Sloppy Joe's is the place to go for evening entertainment, with live bands playing until late in to the night. Bar staff and waitresses work hard to get the drinks to...More

headline: Cheeseburgers in PARADISE....
content: We stopped by Sloppy's after our Pub Crawl Tour booked through the cruise line.  Unfortunately it was not part of the tour so we made sure to stop there and have a bite to eat before checking out the rest of Key West.  Good food,...More

headline: Good but overpriced
content: The sloppy joe was very tasty but rather pricey for the size of sandwich.  Good place to hear some music and a nice assortment of beer.

headline: Have to stop by for a bit of Key West history!
content: Dining area a little cramped due to being a bar area.  Our table sat right next to a garbage can!  Staff very accommodating for bigger parties, they don't mind moving tables to fit you in. Our family ordered the Original Sloppy Joe Sandwich and it...More

headline: We had to stop here :)
content: This was our first trip to Key West, and we had to hit Sloppy Joe's for a drink.  My mojito was fantastic!!  The live music was great.............a FANTASTIC pianist!!!  I could have stayed and listened to him all day, but we didn't have the time....More

headline: Don't Miss this Place
content: This was a fun place to grab lunch.  Live music and a helpful waiter were bonuses.  It was very hot so we were not looking for a big, heavy meal.  We took our waiters suggestion/recommendation  and split a Sloppy Joe as well as their smoked...More

headline: The Duval St. Watering Hole
content:
Depending on the time of day or day of the week you can always catch live entertainment here.
Sloppy Joe's is a landmark for Key West and a cool place to pick up a t-shirt or shot glass as a gift. Live music to adult...More

headline: Great time
content: We just loved sloppy joes bar, what a great time we had singing drinking and just having a blast! The booze is not to badly priced for key west , we loved it !

headline: Perfectly Key West
content: With so many tile and chrome restaurants, the rustic wood setting was a welcome relief.  I couldn't help but think of Ernest Hemingway when looking at the decorations of art and history on the walls and ceilings. The live music was a plus and our...More

headline: Very Overrated
content: Very crowded bar scene. Wait staff not too attentive. Food was very overpriced for what you got. Got their "Famous" Sloppy Joe sandwich. Exact same as you got in the high school cafeteria, no more no less. Tastes like right out of the can at...More

headline: A key West Tradition
content: Cannot visit KW without at least 2 visits for sloppy joes/fries and the buffalo shrimp!!!!  Even my kids love this place!  It is one of the few places I say - "the hell with eating healthy!"- you just have to try it!!!!

headline: Historic but contains adult humor
content: I was glad I went, but only because of the history. The service was only mediocre. The comedy act was adult.

headline: Great Place...Great Drinks
content: If you are looking for good food and great drinks, this is the place for you!  We stopped in for a few hours in the afternoon to hear the entertainment, grab a bit to eat, and get some drinks.  We were not disappointed.  Drinks are...More

headline: Zombie Wait Staff
content: We heard Sloppy Joe's was a cool place to hang. I loved the layout of the bar, nice and open. There were 3 bars to get a drink. You would think there would be no problem to get a drink, right? We sat at one...More

headline: Great Bar Live music Happy staff
content:
Spent a night in the famous Sloppy Joe's (Ernest Hemingway's haunt of old) Sat at small bar and was served by a lovely waitress who's hubby was celebrating his birthday so was on stage with live duo who entertained us musically.
Service great, drinks great,...More

headline: Fun but not for a family in my opinion
content: We had a great time at Sloppy Joe's.  We enjoyed the music, the atmosphere was fun and we had a light lunch.  The lunch wasn't exceptional but did the job.  It was very hot in Key West when we were there and the beer being...More

headline: Lunch
content: We sat at the bar for faster service.  We were waited on by Bonnie, what  GREAT service!  She was very friendly & even found me a bandaid!!!  Would recommend this to anyone, even people with children (but would specify lunch for children though)!!!!

headline: So overrated
content: If you want terribly crowded, noisy, poor service and worse food this is for you. Unfortunately the name apparently brings people in, the service and the food were terrible! We were spending several days in Key West and of course doing the tourist thing on...More

headline: NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY
content: As a young man it was interesting and entertaining.  Drinks were stiff and the sloppy fries were awesome! However, I cringed at the beginning of every song the live band played for fear of what the young girl across from us might hear.  NOT FAMILY...More

headline: Fun place to hang out, good food and music...right in the heart of all the excitment, just down from Mallory Square
content: Always visit Sloppy Joe's when in Key West, just a tradition thing we do, it's got "history" there  being the place where Hemmingway met one of his wives and was his favorite place to hang out.

headline: Great time
content: We stopped in for the history surrounding this local landmark. We ate good food and had lots of good drinks as well. The sledge hammer drink is very very good and cools you off on a hot day as it is a frozen daquiri type...More

headline: Sloppy Joe Fries, Wowsa
content: We ate dinner and lunch here on different days. The service was fast and the food filling. We got 2 sodas an appetizer and 2 sandwich type meals for dinner. Cost around $ 51 with tip. Free soda refills. They had a singing comedy act...More

headline: Great people watching spot
content: We enjoyed a local Key West Sunset beer at this bar our first night and were thoroughly entertained with the live music and people watching. Fun place if you can get a seat.

headline: I got SLOPPY at Sloppy Joe's!
content: The memories I have made at this place over the years will be with me for a life time. I was in Key West June 5th through the 9th and this was my first trip that I was old enough to drink‚Ä¶.needless to say I...More

headline: Don't miss the Sloppy Joe's Pizza~~
content: This is the busiest place in Downtown Key West with live Jazz music and causal service. You can sit wherever you like, and the food are very delicious!!! Especially their Pizza, the sources and meats are really tasty! It is better than their signature sandwich...More

headline: Fun and filling!
content: Went for lunch and drinks with friends. Had fun and listened to live music. Great specialty drinks...bartenders are not shy with alcohol. Fish sandwiches and apps hit the spot. We were there for a few hours.

headline: great entertainment
content: Stopped in the late afternoon for dinner, the food was decent, the beer was cold and the entertainment was NC17 rated.   Nice combination, but beware with younger children.

headline: A fun place to drink
content: We really enjoyed the laid back, fun atmosphere here.  Sure it is a tourist trap, but we were tourists!!!

headline: Busy bar
content: We hadn't been there in about 10 years, but a visiting guest wanted to see Duval and Sloppy Joe's. We went there and found  hundreds of people there, as there usually are. Living in KW, we tend to avoid the busy, overpriced "tourist" joints. This...More

headline: Lots of Fun
content: We were there late afternoon on a Saturday. Had the World Famous Sloppy Joe (tasted like Manwich) and wife had Fish Tacos. Good food, good price, but not remarkable. Two guys playing goofy songs on stage and playing off the crowd. Relaxed and lots of...More

headline: BEST BAR IN TOWN
content: Lets start with Lou the Bar Man. If you haven't had a drink made by Lou you are missing out He is Da Man. The music was great which set up the atmosphere. This place goes off. Good times with family and friends. We will...More

headline: NEVER AGAIN!
content: My daughter and I ordered the pork sandwich and her boy friend a chicken sandwich.  Her sandwich arrived.  A bit later her boyfriend's sandwich arrived.  My sandwich didn't come, so since she wasn't going to finish half of her sandwich, I decided to eat that...More

headline: Legendary Place
content: Every person must visit this legendary restaurant at least 1 time while in Key West. Located conviently on Duval Street it is right downtown where all the shopping and other activities are located.

headline: Legend
content: It's an iconic place that you have to go to at least once when you are in Key West, but trying going during the day cause it's less crowded.

headline: Excellent food and atmosphere
content: Great place to eat and hang out.  Chopped pork sandwich was very tasty, the Phili-cheese steak was to die for.  Pretty good Keylime Pie.  Staff was very polite and upbeat. Excellent for the whole family

headline: Wild and crazy-not for children, but FUN!!
content: The food was very good!  I had a taco salad that was quite large.  The service was very good too.  The entertainment was for adults only - humorous!  We enjoyed ourselves and would do it again!

headline: Normal, ok
content: We went in for drinks and appetizers. The drink was ok, it was 1/2 pina colada, 1/2 daquire. It tasted pretty artificial. The app. was ok. The service was friendly.

headline: Good food, great live band
content: The food and drinks were great. I ordered the blackened chicken sandwich (excellent) and my husband ordered there famous sloppy joe.  The live entertainment was great. They had a band ( all brothers) there from NY.  Make sure to order the pain in the "blank"(...More

headline: Key West icon
content: Visited here on our first day of vacation. This was not my first time here, but it has been quite some time. enjoyable way back when and it hasn't changed. Live music is really good and it usually starts early in the day and well...More

headline: Great place to go.
content: Me and my girlfriend stopped here for lunch while walking Duval Street. The live music was good and the atmosphere was really enjoyable. The drinks were rally good. We ordered a sloppy joe sandwich that was really good, but the fish tacos where AMAZING!

headline: Cool Place
content: Live music, seat yourself, the chili is awesome! Had the nachos with chili and a beer, everyone was friendly. You have to go here. It gets crowded so be prepared.

headline: While on holiday
content: Went there with my family. You should definitely go there while in Key West. It can get a bit crowded.

headline: Florida Keys Trip
content: Walked by it 1 night and stopped to listen to a band that was playing. Chose a night to go back because a band from Baltimore Maryland was there playing. They call themselves the Vinyl Rino's. They were a VERY good band that played all...More

headline: Above average bar food but beyond average fun place
content: It's a definite stop in key west and the staff there are great -- keeping everyone served with food and drinks. It can get a bit crazy when the cruise ships are in town due to the historic nature of the place and it being...More

headline: Great time
content: The live music was great!!! The food was good, I love the Cuban sandwich, my husband loves the original sloppy Joes. The wait staff was incredible. I would high recommend this place for a lunch, we had a great time.

headline: Learn something everyday, where "Sloppy Joes" were invented!
content: Great restaurant named for the sandwich it invented. Watch what you do here, live cam going on in restaurant, bar and outside. I had to have the "Sloppy Joe" and it was delicious. Live entertainment too. Definitely for an adult crowd. Must go to this...More

headline: Fun Place to Hang Out !
content: We stopped in because Sloppy Joe's is a Key West icon.  We stayed for two hours and came back the next night for the live music.  The waitresses, in spite of being very busy, were friendly and attentive.  The live music was high quality, cover...More

headline: Great food!
content: We stopped here for an early supper after our snorkel trip.  We were hungry and Sloppy Joe's did not disappoint.  I ate the best chicken quesadilla of my life here.  Not exaggerating...it was incredible.  They have a varied menu that provides more than your typical...More

headline: Yummy!
content: This is the place where the original sloppy Joe was made. Just had to try one of the originals. It was delicious. Although very crowded service was excellent. Would highly recommend.

headline: Iconic place you must go!
content: We went here for drinks and dancing and had a lot of fun! Band was awesome and bartenders were attentive. Didn't go to any other bars for the evening because I was having such a good time here.

headline: Nostalgic Restaurant
content: Our Key West visit would not be complete until we ate at Sloppy Joe's. It is a true original ambiance from days gone by. It has been updated from the original but the minute you walk in I could envision Ernest Hemingway having a drink...More

headline: Great live band!
content: We did not eat here, we wondered in around midnight and it looked pretty promising.  We were not disappointed!  There was an amazing local rock band playing, so we got a couple beers and headed up closer to the stage.  We were there for a...More

headline: Cool Pub
content: Went there with a group of friends and had a really nice time. Mixed crowd and great band. Drinks are good too.

headline: Great atmosphere
content: Key West is a festive place and Sloppy Joe's is an integral part of it. It's in a great location and the food is good, especially if washed down with a beer or two. Whenever I go there it's busy, which increases the energy of...More

headline: Great pub food @ Sloppy Joe's
content: My husband and I ate here one night during our stay in Key West. The food was very good for pub food. Live music was being played and it was entertaining. I had the crab cake sandwich and my husband had the Philly Cheesesteak sandwich....More

headline: Fun,fun,fun!!!
content: Want to enjoy Key West..then Sloppy Joe's is a must. Great nightlife,drinks,music and so much more.  This is a definite stop for my husband and I every August.

headline: Best Cover Band Ever
content: Not ashamed to admit that we went here three nights in a row (never the only place, but......).  The cover band here is amazing and there was always a fantastic amount of energy, even on a Monday.  The mojitos were great and the service was...More

headline: Awesome food and Music
content: My wife and I stopped in here while on the island for a few hours and loved our lunch.  They had live music, great service and food.  I had the Roast beef dip and my wife the grilled cheese.  It's place is open to the...More

headline: Key West Icon
content: Great place to enjoy food and drink. My wife and I got to Sloppy Joe's right before the lunch crowd.  This place fills up fast and we were lucky we went when we did.  Sloppy Joe‚Äôs has a great atmosphere, good service and good food....More

headline: Great sloppy joes.
content: We had lunch and drinks here because the bar was associated with Hemingway.  I had one of the best sloppy joes ever and highly recommend it.  The atmosphere was great and our bartender was very friendly.

headline: Tourist Trap
content: I went to Sloppy Joe's about 8 years ago, and I loved it.  When we went for vacation this year I was looking forward to eating here again.  The place has turned into a complete tourist trap now.  The food was mediocre and overpriced.  I...More

headline: One place you have to visit !
content: Always on our Itinerary when visiting the Keys is Sloppy's - it is usually busy, often noisy, service can be a little patchy but is always friendly. Music can be almost too loud - but hey this is Key West and a must visit spot....More

headline: Fun and exciting
content: We really enjoyed the food and ambiance at Sloppy Joe's. Excellent waitress service. Good entertainment, the food was great and pricing was very good. Went for lunch two different times and both times the same. None better, in Key West.

headline: Nothing Extraordinary
content: Sloppy Joe's is in an excellent location right on a corner of Duval Street in all the excitement of Key West.  The inside of the restaurant is nice and open.  The service was good, not great, but good.  The food is average and the restaurant's...More

headline: Awesome food and entertainment
content: We enjoyed our lunch, drinks, and the music at Sloppy Joe's.  The fish tacos and conch fritters were the best we found on the island.  Since we enjoy their sister restaurant in Daytona, we gave this one a try and it lived up to/exceeded our...More

headline: Loud, loud and loud
content: This is a tourist trap. It gets very crowded and extremely loud. Live music and drinks flowing. The food is less than thrilling, takes a long time to get, and was cold when it came. It's OK for a quick drink and to say you...More

headline: Had a BLAST
content: Really enjoyed our visit to Sloppy Joe's! Great live music and drink options. Will definitely return again next time.

headline: A must while visiting Key West
content: Great Pub food. Appetizers, sandwiches and salads.  You have to get a sloppy Joe it was the best I ever had! Good service and price.

headline: You can't miss this place!
content: The food here is really not the point. It's ok, and the drinks are overpriced and not great,  but the atmosphere is everything. There is live music at lunch ( at least there has been both times we ate here)and most seats are near the...More

headline: Great Aftlernoon
content: My husband and I walked into Sloppy Joe's looking for a drink and live music. The band and music were very good, and there isn't a bad seat in the house. We did not order any food so I cannot comment on that. I would...More

headline: A big let down
content: Ok folks, go in for some drinks but pass up the food.  Touted as Hemingway's favorite spot all I can think is he never had the food...or he was drunk when he ate it.  Blah and bland.  Reminds me of New Orleans without the ambiance,...More

headline: A MUST when in Key West
content: You have not experienced Key West until you have visited Sloppy Joes. The food, the entertainment, and the entire atmosphere. This is a landmark and a MUST when you visit Key West.

headline: A must for tourists!
content: Tourists flock to this bar. It's a fun place and the food is good. Sloppy joe's are a little sweet but very good. I liked the ambiance. Live music too.

headline: Old Key West
content: No trip to Key West is without a drink at Sloppy Joes.  Busy location right on Duval Street.  Great service - Beverly was an outstanding server - Thanks for the beets+ Bev!  Lots of live entertainment. If you haven't seen the Pete and Wayne show,...More

headline: Not just a bar...
content:
I've been coming to this place for about 20 years. I'm amazed how fast the food is served. This place is always packed and for a good reason. Great, food, drinks and LIVE music! 
A must when in Key West!

headline: Tourist Trap with great bands...
content: We have only eaten here once because we were very hungry and the food was exactly what you expected for a touristy restaurant/bar in Key West. We love to stop by here during our nightly adventures when they have live music on stage, the bands...More

headline: Banging Sloppy Joe's
content: Ok we go here for sloppy joes period but they do give a generous pour on all drinks so expect to get smashed for cheap. By the time i left my knees were wobbling and we all had some delicious sloppy joes and even a...More

headline: Good Enough To Visit A Second Time...
content: We stopped in twice for lunch at Sloppy Joe's.  I didn't have the sloppy joe's, but my husband did, and he said it was great.  The atmosphere and food were very good.  On the first visit, the food came out pretty quickly.  On the second...More

headline: A lot of fun
content: This is the place to go for good food, good entertainment (sometimes a little on the risque' side), and wonderful staff.  It's a great place to begin your journey down Duval Street.  Oh, and try the conch fritters - they're excellent with a cold beer.

headline: Great place
content: Great place to enjoy friends, food and drink. The place was crowded and we approached a table at the same time as another couple so we did the appropriate thing and sat together.  They were from Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. Sloppy Joe‚Äôs has a great...More

headline: good show and eats
content: Loved this place. Had Philly cheesesteak that was great-friends had the hot dog w/ sauce and raved about it. The show was Pete & Wayne and let me tell you-----they were great. Not a show for kids, very adult, raunchy, BUT, it was great. Would...More

headline: Good for a cold one...
content: Tourist trappy bar on Duval.  Crowded, good music.   We had GREAT service despite the place being so crowded (cruise ship people).   Server brought the wrong item but it was quickly corrected.  Might go back for a cold one on a very hot Key West afternoon.

headline: Not disappointed...
content: This landmark delivered a good meal and atmosphere. The live music was not overly loud [lunch time] and had a personable talented singer.

headline: Nice for drinks and dance
content: I spent a great time in Sloppy Joe's by having drinks and dancing with live music! They have a good stage for the live band and enough space to dance.

headline: Can't miss this place
content: A fun place to grab a beer and listen to music. Watch yourself on their street cam. Make sure you stop in for at least one!

headline: Lots of fun if your up for a crowd
content:
Great place to go to hear some live music and if you like a crowd.

This place is always alive with people and music.

Service is great, and staff are friendly.

If you want to chill out maybe head to another bar like Captain Tonys...More

headline: Disapointed with food
content: Many had told us to go here while in Key West.  We were disappointed with the food...our friends had a sloppy Joe and the only thing that came with it was a pickle.  The sandwich was also small for the price.  My husband and I...More

headline: So much fun!
content: We had the best time at this place!  Home of the original Sloppy Joe, it was cool to eat one there and to drink a nice cold beer while listening to great music!  Lots of laughs and fun for all.  This place is packed so...More

headline: drinking a beer a must do
content: the average bar in key west is small but not this one. we hear nice key west live music, good breeze, and lots of history. fun thing to do for an hour. we had a key lime pie it was avg. but we really came...More

headline: Best dance floor on Duval Street
content:
We stopped in for beer and ended up staying and dancing the night away. The band played a lot of music from the 90s and through in some of today's favorites. Half the fun was watching the other dancers on the floor. 

Security was a...More

headline: best night out in keywest
content: Its our third time visiting sloppy joe's Ernest hemingway old haunt, I don't know what he'd make of it now, but we "love it" live music decent food and on this occasion a big shout out to lauren who looked after us all night,thanks.

headline: Iconic Bar
content: Sloppy Joes is an iconic bar due to its connection with Ernest Hemingway, so on our day trip to Key West we just had to visit.  It lives up to its reputation as a lively, loud and vibrant bar.  During our brief stay, there was...More

headline: Beer and  Overall Fun Place
content: We went for Beer and drinks. Stayed at the bar for 3 hours. FUN  bartender was nice and really enjoyable. We had some great  drinks and the pour is good. The bands where OK, not great but OK. Funny they got better after every drink....More

headline: Good Pub Food
content: Had a good quality burger, sampler basket with conch fritters and a delicious basket of fries.  Good service at noon.

headline: Terrible food, terrible service, terrible band, way overpriced.
content: Crabcake sandwich was less than 1/2 inch thick. Fries are $4.25 and are identical to what Burger King serves. Waitress messed up my nacho order (admitted it was her fault), yet huffed and puffed when I sent it back. Band was crude and didn't have...More

headline: fun place
content: We went to Sloppy Joe's while in Key West and had a blast.  The band that was playing that night was incredible.  Everyone was friendly and having fun, drinks were reasonable and the food was good.  It would be hard to find a complaint with...More

headline: Overrated, but def stop for a beer
content: Little cheesy, like alot of KW spots, worth stopping in for a beer, but you wouldn't make it your regular spot if you are there for a few days. Didn't try the food and bands were just OK

headline: Lunch at the Bar
content: Everyone said to stop at Sloppy Joe's.  Well we did and it was a great experience. We sat at the bar for lunch and drinks. The food was average, we had a cheeseburger and chicken fingers.  All food came out quick and hot.  The bartenders...More

headline: Lunch overlooking the beach - just what we wanted
content: My girlfriend and I drove here for the day from Lakeland, only 1 hr 15 min there but over 2 hrs return with traffic.  Beach was lovely, but no shade so either bring your umbrella or rent one.  Water was still chilly in February but...More

headline: Have to see
content: Been there with friends who have been the first time to Key West. They were impressed. Great drinks, great live music and very "atmospheric"!

headline: This place is a must!!
content: What an atmosphere... You can feel Ernest Hemingway in the walls. The bar is not really that fantastic. There are many better bars, but this is something very special :-)

headline: Atmosphere yes - food a definite no!
content: On our day trip to Key West, we dropped by for a "quick" lunch. The beer was cold and entertainment was on stage. We ordered some conch fritters and their fish sandwich (the one with the cheese added). The conch fritters included the side benefit...More

headline: Gotta Try a Sloppy Joe
content: This is a Key West staple.  The entertainment is prime here.  Good drinks.  The gift shop rocks.  Reasonably priced.  And the sloppy fries are awesome!

headline: Drop out Wannabees
content: It has been 16 years since I've been to the Keys and Key West. Sloppy Joe's was a great place to get "sloppy".  Not so much now. No locals, only tourist dressed in their beach bum finest styles and their kids in tow. Ernest would...More

headline: Horrible!  Awful food !!
content: There were 8 of us in our party and no one had a good meal. Sloppy Joe tasted like it came right out of a can of Manwich Sandwich. Patty Melt was on stale bread and way over cooked, could have used it for a...More

headline: Basic food and drinks
content: The food is basic.  Mostly sandwiches and dogs, but they are very good.  The original 'Sloppy Joe' sandwich is very tasty and sloppy.  Do not wear a nice formal shirt, you will probably get something on it, and the patrons may laugh and make comments....More

headline: A must do experience
content: If in Key West, you must visit Sloppy Joe's. The atmosphere is fabulous, relaxed but electric! If you're lucky and a good band are playing the room rocks! Food good, huge portions, and reasonably a priced. A must do experience!

headline: Touristy? Yes. But so what. Go there.
content: Great atmosphere already at 9:30am, very decent food and reasonable prices for booze. Love Sloppy's history and the drinks are good and fairly-priced. It's a can't miss place for grounding oneself in Key West lore.

headline: A very simple menu
content: Sloppy Joe's has a very simple menu...mostly sandwiches/hotdogs.  Side items are extra such as fries, etc.  We were lucky to find a seat...once we got the menu/drinks...it didn't take too long to get our food.  They had a very good entertainer/music the day we were...More

headline: Fun Place
content: We had a sloppy joe  sandwich here and it was very good.  Typical bar like atmosphere, with loud music and loud patrons, but if you are in Key West, you have to dive right in there and enjoy.  Service was a bit slow.  Enjoyed looking...More

headline: Never use this word but dick bartender
content: I was having a "fabulous" time as the skinny gray haired bartender asked me. He said they use that word at the other end of the street. Not sure what he meant hmm. Didn't ask me if I wanted a drink. Husband and I left...More

headline: Bar that serves food and music
content:
Don't expect any culinary delights from this bar that serves up fast food, alcohol and music/comedy.   

Stopped in for lunch and I, by default, had to try the namesake Sloppy Joe's.  $10 for a hamburger bun filled with a single scoop of Sloppy Joe slop....More

headline: Great atmospher, food was good too.
content:
Most people probably go here for drinks and a party.  I went for lunch and the history.

The waiter was really friendly and suggested other places in Key West for shopping besides the t shirt row that lines the main street.  Food was good, but...More

headline: Just a bar
content: We were with someone who's visiting first time so we ate lunch here. It was 11am and filled with drunk people already and a live band. My taco salad was good but others didn't care for their fish sandwiches which didn't come with any sides....More

headline: Plastic,Plastic,Plastic
content: We were a party of 7, without asking, 7glasses of water was served in large disposable plastic cups. Then we ordered our drinks making the grand total to 14 plastic cups on the table. This kind of environmental waste makes me sick. The food was...More

headline: Great food and fun atmosphere
content: We enjoyed our first visit to Sloppy Joe's very much. I stuck to ordering the famous sloppy joe and sloppy-rita and I was not disappointed. Good music always seems to be playing as well. Service was good and prices reasonable.

headline: Everyone says to go
content: Everyone who has been to Key West says to go to Sloppy Joe's! Hemingway used to frequent this bar-- go for the history (the bloody Mary's are good too)!

headline: Disappointed this time
content: I go to Sloppy Jose's every time I visit a Key West. This time I was disappointed in the food. The onion rings were off and the Sloppy Joe was different then the last time I went. The singer was great.

headline: So much fun!
content: This is a "must do" if you've never been to Key West.  As long as you don't have sensitive ears (based on some of the entertainment which is always funny but can hilariously go off track quickly), Sloppy Joe's is a great take (we've seen...More

headline: Piano man
content: Good sandwiches and beer and a great piano man. Barry Cuda can play it. We even danced between tables before we left.

headline: Sloppy Joe's - great food!
content: Casual atmosphere and GREAT food.  The sloppy joe fries were outstanding, with lots to take home and enjoy another time.  The Sloppy Joe sandwich is iconic and delicious also.  The story behind the restaurant and how it moved from it's original location a block away...More

headline: Must stop in!
content: Got to go to Sloppy Joe's when in Key West. Fun, old timey atmosphere, good music, had a relaxing afternoon. Of course the food was good and sloppy! We had a sloppy joe, great! sloppy quesadilla, great!, fish taco's (not my fav.) and SJ fries,...More

headline: A Must See for Key West
content:
This is a great place to stop by for lunch or even dinner.
Of course the Sloppy Joes are delicious and so are the SJ french fries. There is a stage and usually someone is playing/singing but it's a very conversational place. Loved it so...More

headline: Great Afternoon!
content: Never disappointing and should be a must with everyone's visit to Key West. Our server Justin was great and attentive with our party of 6. The piano player was playing good music for a relaxing afternoon. See you next year Sloppy Joe's!

headline: Old-timey fun!
content: I visited Sloppy Joe's with my husband a few years ago during a cruise stop.  Having just returned from another Caribbean cruise, I realized I never reviewed Sloppy Joe's!  Well, from what I remember, I very much enjoyed the "old-timey" appeal of Sloppy Joe's.  I...More

headline: This place is fun!
content: Loved the bar area.  They have three separate bars.  They have a fabulous stage.  When we were there, there wasn't music.  I would love to go back for that!

headline: Minnesota review
content: We stopped by for lunch and a couple beers. The place is lively and full of people at 2p! There was a guy singing at the piano and we enjoyed our stop at Sloppy Joes! It's definitely a place to visit!

headline: a fun stop in key west
content: Stopped at this restaurant while on a cruise ship vacation. It was St. Patrick's Day and very crowded...however we  walked in a got a table for 4 just as a group were leaving. The waitress was  very prompt and courteous. We all had drink local...More

headline: Great place to eat!
content: We visited the keys, asked around about THE place to eat and everyone pointed us to Sloppy Joe's. The waitress was GREAT, very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was wonderful, very inviting and fun. The food was excellent, we had onion rings as an appetizer...More

headline: So SOOOO Much Fun
content:
Ok, maybe my husband and I don't get out much, but OMG we had one of the most fun nights we've had in years!

We went to the legendary restaurant more for the history, the Hemingway mystic, without really knowing what to expect and were...More

headline: Fun restaurant with great service
content: We were a family of four . The food was great . The band did a great job and the service was great. We will be back next time.

headline: Great Bar, Good Food in Key West
content: Needed a place to have a bite while in Key West and decided on Sloppy Joe's on Duval Street. We had been there once before and I remembered how much I enjoyed the Sloppy Joe. This trip, however, my wife thought we should eat lighter...More

headline: Very Good meal, great atmosphere
content: We stopped at Sloppy Joe's while our Holland America cruise ship was in port on Saturday, March 29.  They had a lot of options on their menu, but we decided to order what they are famous for, and we were not disappointed.  We entered the...More

headline: Must do on your 1st trip to Key West
content: We decided to go to Sloppy Joes before the Sunset Celebration at Mallory Square.  Service -- friendly & fast; drinks good; fish tacos were very tasty.  You do have to be prepared for the prices .. but pretty much all food/drinks in Key West are...More

headline: Not a biggie to me but good place.
content: Large and very popular. Drinks are ok. Did not get all the hype but did see much jumping which makes great. Would do again

headline: $19.00 Sloppy Joe?
content: Most expensive sandwich I've ever purchase for what I got.  And the sloppy joe wasn't as good as a "Manwich".  Had the Nachos too, they piled a bunch of little broken pieces of tortilla chips and then a few (and I mean a few) then...More

headline: Great Music
content: This is a must visit place.  I loved the drinks, but liked the band even more.  It is easy to see why Sloppy Joe's was a favorite of Hemingway.  Make a point to stop and see the place.

headline: Do it to say you did
content: Well, I guess you kinda have to go here, being that it is famous and all.  That being said, we only stayed for one drink, just to say that we did.  The place was super crazy packed, seemed fun but just to crowded.  It seemed...More

headline: Friendly service, food....edible
content: We were visiting Miami and took a day trip to The Keys. Hearing all about Sloppy Joe's as a landmark, we decided to stop in for lunch and a drink. Although the bartenders were very friendly, the food was just average and underwhelming. I expected...More

headline: Fun place, good guitarist, nachos magnifico
content: Enjoyed an afternoon of drinks and nachos here.  The guitarist played for 2 hours staright and was excellent.  Be sure to try the nachos....best we ever had.  Loaded up on Hemingway shirts and touristy stuff.  Just a great palce to kick back in the afternoon,...More

headline: Food and music
content: The sloppy joes are to die for!!! Oh the other food are good too, just sloppy joes my favorite.  All different kind of bands. Great gift shop too. What more can I say, Hemmingway's bar. Always busy never a dull moment. The drinks are good...More

headline: Drinks are great. Nothing wrong with the food.
content:
Mixed Drinks are some of the best around. Food, nothing wrong with it. I had the sloppy joe and it was fine.

The Sloppy Rita however blew my mind.

5 stars for the drink. 3 for the food and atmosphere. 4 overall.

It was a...More

headline: Sisters
content: My sisters and I stopped in for a drink. Very expensive. The singers that particular afternoon were funny for a while and then their music which was written by themselves got vulgar. Didn't enjoy.

headline: Always a good time
content: I used to live in the Keys and we went here all the time and loved it. I recently went back while visiting some friends that still live there and the place was just as I remembered it.  A fun crowd, great live music, good...More

headline: Good time :)
content: We went to sloppy Joe's twice during our stay in Key West. First time was for lunch and the place was packed! The vibe was chill with live music. Regardless of how busy it was our server was efficient and very friendly. I had the...More

headline: A Key West Icon
content: We always visit Sloppy Joe's when we are in Key West and once again we were not disappointed.  Great atmosphere, music, friendly service and a good plate of nachos washed down with cool beer.  What else can you ask for?

headline: Awesome experience!
content: Wonderful atmosphere! Less than 10 mins after we arrived in key west we had a wonderful meal. Wonderful waitress, nice music. In a wonderful location, right at the action. The sloppy Joe and the fish tacos were wonderful and worth eating again!

headline: Touristy must a must stop
content: A fun, "must stop for a drink" bar. It was all tourists, and not the true authentic Key West feel. But it was a fun place and I'm glad I went and checked it off the list.

headline: Great food and entertainment!
content: Sloppy joes has great food and great specials. Their fish is tasty. The price of food and drink was reasonable. The piano player during the day was very entertaining. Would recommend Sloppy Joes as a must in Key West.

headline: Great time
content: We stopped in twice on our trip. The first time just for drinks and we had to go back because the food looked so good!!! We had the Sloppy Fries and they were awesome!!! Great drinks too. My favorite was the Cherry Kiss!!  Great entertainment...More

headline: Sloppy fries!
content:
A great atmosphere in this legendary bar come restaurant.  We called in for lunch and found ourselves a table pretty quickly before it got really busy.  There was a guy singing and playing piano which was great.

We ordered a beer and a frozen margarita,...More

headline: Good food & location
content: This is great for sit down lunch, doors are open so if there is a breeze you will feel it, there is music and food portions were very good.  A good location, good decor.

headline: Key West Tradition
content: Third trip to Key West and every time, we end up in Sloppy Joes at least three nights.  Great gathering place and great music.  You have not "done" Key West without a stop at Sloppy Joes.

headline: Must See In Key West
content: Great crowd on Duvall Street right where the action is.  Had a Sloppy Joe, thought it was a little 'sweet', but very good.  Even with a large crowd had good service and an overall great experience.

headline: A Key West Tradition!
content: Great time!  Good place to stop in for a little break from the sun and get a traveler before hopping to the next bar...great entertainment and people watching!

headline: Fun atmosphere, average food, high prices
content: We had heard about this place and stopped for lunch. I had their famous Sloppy Joe's sandwich, my husband had boneless chicken wings. My sandwich came with a pickle slice - only - and was almost $10. My husband and I agreed that I make...More

headline: Famous by Legend only
content:
It is a must to stop in to have a drink so we were told.  My drink came from a machine and was average at best.  They feature music that was very enjoyable and which covered up an flaws they have as a restaurant.  

We...More

headline: Great atmosphere
content: The place is very popular so it has great atmosphere. There is usually live music which is great to enjoy your meal. The drinks are a tad pricey but the food is really reasonable with large portions. Service is excellent!

headline: Ernest Hemmingway's stomping grounds
content: My husband and i wanted to try this place after taking the trolly tour through Key West. The food was good but it has a small menu. The service was fast and the prices were fair. The bar tenders were friendly and busy! This place...More

headline: Experience it once
content: My husband and I ducked in here after walking down Duval Street for hours.. We were parched! I had a pi√±a colada ( albeit a rather strong one, I might add) and ordered some sloppy fries upon a recommendation. Yuck! The fries came out looking...More

headline: Great place in Key West.
content:
The history here is deep.  The food and drinks just add to it.
The night life is just icing on the cake.

headline: Great Time
content: Good service.  Cold beer.  Fun bands.  Great hang-out. People watching at it's best. Just eat somewhere else before you go.  Maybe we caught them on a bad night, but we went two for two on bad dishes.

headline: Busy place!
content: I love sloppy joes! It is a very busy place, but people are great and the food is good tooo! The entertainment is good too!

headline: Spring Break
content: As usual this is a great place to have lunch, Dinner or just drinks..we have done all three everytime we are in Key West.  In March they had an excellent band I wish I could remember their name..but it was great a bunch of young...More

headline: have a drink and listen to great music !!
content: likes the decor and ambiance -very key west !!! Nice menu and very friendly atmosphere - good place to have a few drinks and take in the view on duval street !!!

headline: Touristy, But Fun
content: Sure it's a tourist destination with the Hemingway heritage, but it was also a fun place for lunch with live entertainment. At 3:30 on a Wednesday it was crowded, but we found a table in the back corner. Perfect for seeing action in the bar...More

headline: Yummy, great service and fun
content: I have been to this place twice and will definitely be a must any time I am in Key West.  The first time we took the recommendation from the waitress and ordered the Sloppy Fries to split between the two of us.  They were so...More

headline: Food was so, so!
content: Food was so, so but the entertainment was exceptionally good.  Kudos for the Doerful family.  They were exceptional.

headline: Great family band from Upstate New York!
content: We fell into the place as a rest stop from 10K+ step walk through historic area. Piano player was good, but the band of (biological) brothers who followed from Upstate NY got the place moving, especially the eight year old's rendition of "I Love Rock-n-Roll"....More

headline: Must stop!
content: Live music, great apps and cold beer. A must stop while on Duval St in Key West. Nice little gift shop attached to pick up Sloppy Joe's memorabilia

headline: Don't miss this restaurant!!
content: Great service, great music, great food, & great atmosphere!!  Don't miss this stop if you are in Key West!!

headline: Just Average
content: Food was very mediocre and pricey. You really are paying to say that you went to Sloppy Joe's. Service was pretty good and music was okay - we were there during the day so it's probably much different at night.

headline: Fun stop in Key West!
content:
We've stopped here twice for lunch on Key West port days while cruising. We had a great experience both times. Sloppy Joe's has a fun atmosphere and good food. Will be back! 

There's also several webcams in the restaurant - it's fun to call friends...More

headline: Great Entertainment and a fun time!
content:
This is a great casual atmosphere to get in from the heat and be entertained by some very unique locals and guest performers.

The hamburgers we had were very good and the beer selection was great, and we had fun during our visit.

headline: Must stop!
content: One of the must see places in Key West. Great bar with Chonch fritters and cold beer! Great live music too!

headline: Delicious Conch Chowder
content: A lot of their menu is pretty standard bar fare but their conch chowder was delicious. Wait staff was helpful and prompt and it was a fun place to eat and dance. Unlike many other bars on Duval Street it was not packed with "Spring...More

headline: Bad food.
content: Go there for the atmosphere, not the food. Popular tourist spot, but service is slow and food was poor.

headline: A must Key West Stop
content: Great bar & restaurant, a must visit for a top Key West night stop.  Great beer selection.  It is always busy, you might have a wait for a table, but well worth the visit.

headline: they serve drinks here!!!!
content: well, yeah, its a bar, but its a whole lot more...its a tradition....you have to got here at least once in your lifetime, just to say you've been there...with that being said, be sure to stop in and enjoy the drinks, food, and very good...More

headline: Sloppy Joe's - great sandwiches and entertainment
content: Sloppy Joe's has the best sloppy joe sandwiches and The Doerfel Family provide great entertainment!!  Fun place!

headline: Mediocre and loud
content: It's a tourist trap that is loud and has very average food, and slow service. Peek inside to take a look, then go somewhere else.

headline: A Busy Happening Place !
content: Crusing with Carnival our first stop was charming Key West, Florida. I had been there before in the late 80¬¥s and still it has that laid back feel, although it is more crowded with tourists they are well accommodated. Our Trolley ride was informative and...More

headline: Very fun !
content:
We were with our family on a cruise to Key West.  Stopped at sloppy Joe's for drink and a appetizer It was very busy and fun. We had  a mojito, pretzel and listened to some live music.
We had a great time and would definitely...More

headline: Always a freakin good time!
content: We love visiting Key West.  We wouldn't come here, though, without a stop at Sloppy Joes Saloon.  Beer and Margaritas were great.  Food and band were wonderful.

headline: Well - A Key West must stop for tourists
content:
When we have company in the Keys we take them to Key West (or send them alone). Sloppy Joe's is one of the best known and biggest tourist draws. 
The music is fun but the place is a cavern. Busy all the time and noisy...More

headline: Fun!
content: We spent an evening in the thick of the live entertainment - which was not for the faint of heart! The service was good, the servings were huge, and the crowd was lively.

headline: When in Rome...errr Key West
content: It's Key West - why the heck would you come and NOT visit the places that make it what it is?  Stopped in for a couple beers and conch fritters at the bar and enjoyed the piano player for an hour.  Decadence at it's best,...More

headline: Good for Drinks and Music
content: One of the classic places to experience in Key West. If you're lucky enough to catch Pat Dailey playing guitar and regaling the crowd, you're in for some real local color!

headline: Wanted to visit this icon of KW.
content: Stopped in here one afternoon while staying in the keys, had a cocktail, watched a performer, and had a good time. I paid for two drinks with a fifty dollor bill, got change for a twenty. Had to chase down the waiter, he said he...More

headline: Sloppy Joes has Sloppy Service
content: My credit card was stolen by the waitress, Very disappointed with the service. They handled the situation in a completely unprofessional manner... Tourist trap in my opinion!

headline: Prime time energy
content: Great service and the place was packed. The band was very entertaining and they kept the crowd involved the whole evening. They ran out of the beer I was drinking so I had to switch to another. But I like changing it up anyway. People...More

headline: Fun Experience!!
content: We initially went on a Sunday afternoon because we heard that they had some Hemingway artifacts. The place was a hopping and vibrant location with all sorts of activities and things happening. It seems to be a mix of both locals and tourists that frequent...More

headline: Best sloppy joe ever
content: This place was awesome, it was big, open and fun. Live music and a party atmosphere for the whole family. I had the sloppy joe and it was great, my wife had the crab sandwich and my son the conch fritters. There was more crab...More

headline: Key West Tradition
content: After visiting Hemingway's house and seeing all those cats, lunch is in order (or at least a drink).  Hemingway hung out here in the 30's, and it's a good choice.  Food is good bar-fare, service is friendly, and the crowd fun. Authentic sloppy joes on...More

headline: Fun!
content: Loved the food, the sloppy rita margaritas, and the rum runners!  Our waitress was so friendly, we will return again to Key West and this will be one of the first places we go again to.

headline: Fun Touristy Place!
content: Stopped here one afternoon while walking around.  Sat at the bar; Bonnie (who has been there for years) is excellent!  Great drinks and makes good suggestions & good conversation all while taking care of so many others!  Some fellow was singing, so made it a...More

headline: Our Favorite in Key West
content: This is our favorite stop in Key West! Food is great, drinks are the best! Staff is very friendly and attentive. There is no place like Sloppy's!!

headline: Gotta say that you have been there
content:
This is one of those places that you will want to say that you have been there.   If you time it right, your friends can even catch you on the web cam :)

This is Hemingway's watering hole and the place from which he took...More

headline: Famous and a must stop while you are on BI
content: Always busy and always fun. The food is very good (but not the best) but we go because the place is always rockin!! Great fift shop, fun service and good lookin women.

headline: Good Local Spot
content: This is a fun place to eat lunch. The food was good. Of course, we had the sloppy joes which were very tasty but sloppy! The singer was entertaining.

headline: lunch
content: We tried the Sloppy Joe and it was different but good. We like to visit Key West. Also, we took one of the tours for a bike ride and that was great.

headline: Great party atmosphere!
content: A few of us had visited Sloppy Joes before.  The KW Sunset Ale was a good choice of beverage.  Friends back home spotted us right away on the Webcam - lol

headline: Yummy!
content: Sloppy Rita was very good. A bit pricey but tasty. Loved our Sloppy Joe pizza. Made from scratch and was worth the wait.

headline: Name says it all
content: Had to try Sloppy Joe's while in Key West.  The place was crowded and loud every time I passed by, but my friend and I were determined to go.  Finally decided to go at lunch time.  Place was still packed and included live entertainment.  Saw...More

headline: Overall A Great Lunch or Dinner Choice
content: World famous Sloppy Joe's deserves it's fame. What a place, great ambiance, outstanding  entertainment, good food, great service. Do not expect to carry on a conversation, or have a romantic evening. It's loud and noisy and a heck of a lot of fun. I had...More

headline: Good atmosphere all around
content: You have to make a stop at Sloppy Joe's! We saw a band there by the name of the Juliano Brothers! They were great! Our server was one of the best ever! She so handles a very large crowd of people and with a smile...More

headline: Busy place, great atmosphere
content: We stopped for lunch and a drink.  We had the fish taco and the full moon.  The food was great.  The servicings were large. The service was great.  They had entertainment going when we were there.  If you like pub fare and the pub atmosphere,...More

headline: MUST visit in Key West
content: Sloppy Joes is a tradition on Duval. We love the atmosphere--live music and the drinks. Its our go to spot when we are in town.

headline: Great Bar in Key West
content: Great bands, plenty of room to have fun. The waitresses are the most attentive and efficient I have ever had the pleasure of meeting.

headline: Not missing anything
content: The band was okay, but it was so busy and there was nowhere to sit. The crowd was older and it was like watching my parents dancing everywhere (not saying it's bad, but if you're looking for a young crowd, this isn't it). The drinks...More

headline: What an experience!
content: Music, food, people serving was awesome!! Each night we almost closed the place. The place is for mature people though not for teens please.

headline: shopping
content: I went shopping and stopped in for a cocktail and a bite to eat. I liked the atmosphere the music and the good food so i went back a few days later for lunch again.

headline: very good entertainment in a place thats alive
content: sloppy joe's has consistently good entertainment that seems to run from noon until midnight.  the groups featured were interesting, but all of the different bands that played throughout our stay were of good quality (and certainly seemed to be better than others that we  passed...More

headline: Stopped here for lunch and some drinks while visiting Key West for the day.
content: We were in Key West for a day trip, having driven down from Key Largo.  We really didn't have a plan.  We just wanted to check the area out.  We decided to eat at Sloppy Joe's just because it's a landmark in Key West.  We...More

headline: Necessary Stop
content: A must stop bar for drinks if for nothing other than it's history.  Didn't eat but the drinks were very good and bartender was great.

headline: Rude waitress
content: We tried having lunch at Sloppy Joe's without success. Arrived there with my wife close to 1:00pm and the place was half full so , really it was not about being crowed or anything close to that. The waitress that was supposed to take our...More

headline: What a disappointment!
content: I was so excited to eat here and see where Hemingway drank and Jimmy Buffet sang. When we sat down, the place was very busy. Most everyone was over 40 years old, but the music playing was hip hop and Katy Perry, etc. No one...More

headline: One of the Best Spots for Entertainment in Key West
content: In the past, I always included Sloppy Joes on my tour of Key West mainly for the traditional Sloppy Joes Sandwich. This visit, I was staying close to Duval St, and got to enjoy their fantastic, never ending list of great bands. Go for the...More

headline: "Best Sloppy Joes"
content: Had dinner there on our last night in Key West - Thursday, Jan. 16, 2014.  Decided to try the sloppy joes and they were actually very good - a little sweet - but very good.  It was very crowded, not many people dining, more people...More

headline: Not impressed
content: Over rated, when the cruise ships are in town, forget about a place to sit and hang with friends, bar staff was rude.

headline: Sloppy Joe's is the best bar in Key West.
content: Just returned from Key West, and on the advice from friends, stopped in for a drink at Sloppy Joe's Bar. Much to our delight the bar was packed with everyone cheering on a band called the Doerfels. 5 young boys, all brothers, who played a...More

headline: Tourist bar but what the heck
content: Pretty good sized bar with very good bar food.  Yes, when the cruise ships are in town, almost everybody is a tourist.  They did have live music and prices were not terrible.  We did not go to Margaritaville but I doubt it could have been...More

headline: A MUST VISIT
content: Sloppy Joe's is always a must visit if you take a trip to Key West.  The atmosphere is always enjoyable and fun.  The drink prices are tad bit high, compared to other bars in the area.  There is typically a band playing - which is...More

headline: Yummp sloppy Joe
content: We all got the Sloppy Joes and all decided it was best to eat them with forks.  the food was tasty and Service was good.  There was live music and the place was packed.

headline: Obligatory cheesy tourist trap, but still fun.
content: Crowded with tourists, but still a fun atmosphere, with friendly service, decent food (especially the Arepas, a Colombian appetizer) and good live music.

headline: Must stop
content: Drinks, appetizers and a little Hemingway history. Live music and lots of people having fun made this a great stop.

headline: Duh - Get the Sloppy Joe.
content: Four of us waited for a table to clear and then Katie bar the door.  We were standing next to the table talking to the people that were finishing their drinks and when they stood up, WOW, it was like Black Friday at Wal-Mart.  If...More

headline: Great Lunch
content: Enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant and the food.  We had the Sloppy Joe sandwich and was very good.  Be prepared to eat with a knife and fork because you can not pick it up.  I will eat here and have the same thing on...More

headline: We had a GREAT time!
content: No trip to Key West is complete without a visit to Sloppy Joe's.  We enjoyed the entertainment, Pete and Wayne, so much that we stayed the entire time they played having multiple drinks and appetizer and then dinner.  It would have been nice if all...More

headline: Love This Place...a Must Visit!
