content: Great atmosphere surrounded by interesting Hemingway and fishing memorabilia. Live music was better than the karioki kickouts we heard in some other bars, the table service was prompt and friendly. The menu was reasonably varied but it had to be the original Sloppy Joe sandwich...More

headline: It's a tradition
content: For us, it's a tradition to head directly to Sloppy Joe's after getting off the Key West Express.  We have been there many times and one thing Sloppy Joe's is, is reliable.  You know the quality of the food, music and service is going to...More

headline: Always Great!
content: We went to Sloppy Joe's in December of 2011 and had a great time. We have been there numerous times and have never had a bad experience. The food is always good, the service is always good and the atmosphere, for what it is, is...More

headline: Duval St.
content: Food is OK, drinks are OK, music is usually very good.  Tourist Mecca!

headline: Don't eat here
content: But come for the music and beer and beer and beer and beer

headline: A Key West tradition
content: As others have said, any visit to Key West should include a stop here.  This is the second phyical location of the bar where Pappa Hemingway would hangout when he lived on the island.  The only food I've had here was the conch fritters, but...More

headline: It's a dump folks.
content: You walk into the place and you immediately get the sense that somebody thought it was a good idea to market the name and the Hemingway mystique.  Hemingway took his own life and this place ought to follow suit.  There simply wasn't anything charming about...More

headline: Live from Key West!
content:
visit was Jan. 2011
the food here has always been good and the music and a drink take away all your cares!
visited about 8 times over the last 5 years.

headline: Super sweet Sloppy Joe's are terrible.
content: Atmosphere is ok, service is average, & the food is gross. Please save yourself & eat before you visit.

headline: If I could only remember...
content:
This is a popular bar in KW. They are known for great bands. The drinks are cold, the music rocks...and I wish I could remember more...LOL! You'll have a blast here!
PS---they do also have food.

headline: Finally!
content: Really autentic - I was afraid that the bar should have turned into a tourist-trap, but not! Really nice

headline: If you're in Key West you have to stop in
content: It's a tradition for us to stop in and have a drink everytime we're in town.  The bands are ok, food ok, atmosphere - well what can I say other than Key West...

headline: Touristy, but fun
content: OK, you probably want to steer clear of the food, the restroom and the mixed drinks. But if you're out for a fun, loud time, want to make some new friends, and drink cheap beer -- this is the place!! And, it's supposed to be...More

headline: Sloppy joes sloppy joe's are not the best.
content: Sorry but manwich make better slopy joe's thay you do the chilie was just a hair better but I could get a great one at wendy's.

headline: Just a tourist trap really
content: nothing special about this place, like captain's better

headline: A must see
content:
A stop at Sloppy Joes is a must if you are in Key West. There is always live music playing. Love the laid back atmosphere that you feel while you are in Key West.
Have a beer or two while you are here and you...More

headline: Fun bar - so-so bar food.
content: If you order the namesake Sloppy Joe, you'll be disappointed.  It's kind of a soggy mess.  Burgers are just OK.  Can't think of anything memorable on the menu.  But, it's a fun bar and they have good bands during the day and at night.

headline: good sloppy joe
content: Go during the day for a family environment and good casual atmosphere, and go at night for live music and over 21 crowd.  Had cheese fries and sloppy joe, good and filling.  Great location on Duval Street

headline: A Fun Place!
content: Slopppy Joe's is a fun restaurant on Duval Street in the middle of all the action in Key West.  Their beer is ice cold and there is a stage with entertainment all during the day and night.  It has a long history of famous people...More

headline: OK....
content: I have to say, I was a little disappointed.  We had a few drinks and had intended to eat here but the menu just wasn't appealing.  I know this place has a great reputation, but I just didn't see it.

headline: Great Tourist Spot
content: If you don't mind a crowded spot that draws in the cruise ship crowds, this is the place for you.  We loved the sloppy joes - tasty and plenty!  It's noisy and fun - a few of our group went back several times for the...More

headline: Not bad, but not nearly as good as expected
content:
The service, food, drinks, and live music were all so/so.
During our two weeks stay in Key West we went once.
We walked by several times but never went back in.
There are much better places to spend your time/money in Key West.

headline: The bar!
content: We did not eat here, just had drinks.  Great atmosphere, entertainment was really good!  A fun place to go!

headline: You can't miss Sloppy Joe's
content: Always a band playing - decent Sloppy Joe swag to buy - friendly staff - being part of Key West!

headline: Sloppy and Fun!
content: Fun and Casual.  Julie was our waitress and she was awesome.  The Sloppy Joe is delicious.  If you are just going for drinks, try the Sloppy Fries.  The entertainment is good and the place is always filled with excitement.

headline: As expected touristy but still fun
content: Makes the volume work on a busy corner with lots of tourists coming and going. location, location, location on Duval. Lots of other choices nearby but still an interesting place to visit.

headline: Only Bar in Town
content: Sloppy's is a destination in itself.  Don't miss it.  Great people and great entertainment.

headline: Great place to hang and relax.
content:
Love Sloppy Joe's.  Food is good.  Love the entertainment.
You never know who you will see.  Kenny Chesney has walked in, Peyton Manning has been there...so many  Drinks are great.  Can eat expensive or at a low cost.  When we are on the island, we...More

headline: Great atmosphere, drinks and food
content: This was our 2nd trip to Sloppy Joes off of a cruise ship.  We did the same as last time and share their famous sloppy joe sandwich and got a drink.  Both were good as well as the atmosphere with entertainment during the day.  We...More

headline: Good food, great atmosphere!
content: A lot of atmosphere and great music! I had the Pulled Pork sandwich and my husband had a burger. The prices were decent and the food was good. We kind of ate there so we could say we were at Sloppy Joe's. It was an...More

headline: Great Place to Check Out
content: My wife and I along with my two daughters wanted to stop here because so many people raved about it. They told us you have to stop by Sloppy Joe's and we did. The place was crowded, the band that was playing was good, and...More

headline: Lots of fun
content: While the place is really nothing special we seemed to always end up here. It must be that the fun atmosphere and the openess of the place. The live entertainment was great and the drinks were great as well.  Just a fun place to go...More

headline: Take it or leave it
content: We walked by for 4 days until there was live music, we went in finally, there was music playing!! ordered app and drinks, which were okay. much better places to choose from.

headline: Gotta try it!
content:
We went to Sloppy Joe's for lunch.  Service was fast and friendly.  Food was excellent.  Atmosphere was bar-like and the music was a little loud for the middle of the day.  Prices were reasonable.
Overall, we were satisfied and would eat there again.

headline: Very high energy bar with great music
content: This is a must go to place when in Key West.  Very fun place to stop in and have a drink while listening to some good music.  A little over priced but one of the better bars on Duval.

headline: awesome place to party and eat. lots of fun and good music
content: The food was so good here . good band place just rocked. would go back again next time there. T|his is the place to party

headline: Fun
content: Fun atmosphere for a couple drinks. Uncle Lou made great mojitos

headline: Still pretty authentic
content:
Very busy place that still had quick service - extra points for that. They have a great beer menu.
It's full of memorabilia of Hemingway and the ceiling is covered with hanging flags from around the world.
Worth the experience

headline: Classic Sloppy
content: Go there and enjoy a Sloppy Joe hamburger, or a Sloppy Joe pizza. Or just have anything!! Amazing place, live music, waiters ok (not super great), drink a beer and walk Duval St.

headline: EVERYONE GOES TO SLOPPY JOE'S
content: SLOPPY JOES IS ALWAYS PACKED.  Food is good, drinks keep flowing and entertainment was enjoyed by all! Our waitress was excellent..attentive and pleasant even with a packed house!

headline: Great Place to Party
content: Everything was good...drinks, service and the band.

headline: A must stop...
content: Even if Ernest never drank in this location...still a fun bar, great entertainment and good time.

headline: Fun Tourist Stop
content: It's has a fun atmosphere and the food is standard bar fare. I would still stop by and experience it at least once.

headline: I will GO BACK just to eat HERE!!!
content: We only had 40 minutes to eat as we had to be back on our ship.  We asked our waiter how long it would take to get the food and he responded with 10-15 minutes.  Our food was at our table a lot sooner than...More

headline: what else is there to eat there
content: Good food, but of course have the sloppy joe. juast a fun place to visit

headline: Great food!
content: Sloppy Joe's was very busy. Took a little while for the waitress to get to the table, but once we explained we didn't have a lot of time due to having to catch a boat, she made sure that we were well taken are of....More

headline: Bar food, good music and an old Key West flavor
content: You have to stop in at Sloppy's at least once on your trip to Key West. This is one of the island's oldest bars. The food is average, but the service is friendly and the entertainment is good. Catch the Pete & Wayne show after...More

headline: Historic landmark
content: Staff are the most friendly of all, and the entertainment is always great. Price is good. What more can you ask. Sloppy Joe's is a "must go" when in Key West

headline: Great time! Great food & drink!
content: Went there for drinks around 4pm and there was a band  that was  really good! Played cover tunes. The drinks were a bit expensive, but it was still a good time. We shared some sloppy fries which were amazing! They had cheddar and peperjack cheese...More

headline: Fun atmosphere
content: Nachos and margaritas.  Both good.  Good live music.

headline: Lots of laughs in key west
content: Went there a couple of nights for happy hour and listed to Pete and Wayne. Pretty irreverent but seems to fit the venue. Drinks were just ok, service was ok but not great, but a fun atmosphere. Try it......

headline: This is the one place u have to stop in
content: Fun fun fun.  Yes you must stop here. U will have fun. O look at the web cam right outside  ur friends back home can see u.  The sloppy Rita is a great drink. But only have one

headline: always gotta stop in..
content: always have a decent band.. nice big bar... and great apperal all in one.. makes a great place to stop and the webcam on the streets....

headline: Fun
content: A great time  We had a great waitress, Julie. Fun place to drink and eat. They have live entertaiment. A must place when you visit the Key's.

headline: Our Trip
content: Its a good place for a drink and have something to eat theres live music on every day sometimes it can be very load though

headline: Not what you think
content: Just another bar with over priced drinks and bad service. Not as clean as I would like a bar but I went in anyway because of the name another two for one place my first and my last.

headline: The BEST margaritas!
content: We decided to visit Sloppy Joe's just because we were hungry and tired.  Boy, were we glad we went in!  The atmosphere is lively, the drinks are strong, and the food was delish.  I especially loved the sloppy fries with my sloppy 'rita.  I was...More

headline: standard bar. nothing special.
content: Visited. you get what you see and hear. standard fayre really, nothing extraordinary.  Band playing was good. give it a go.

headline: Fablicious and Fantastic Entertainment.
content: The Jersey Brothers were playing during Fantasy Fest in Oct of 2011 and they were fantastic.  The songs they played reached people of all ages and had them rocking.  Sloppy Joes was packed and, yet, they managed to get ourvfood to us quickly and it...More

headline: More then you expect
content: Wonderful atmosphere! Live music, great decor , friendly people!  Food was super!  Had original sloppy Joe special , wife had bacon cheese burger shared huge basket of fries,  everything tasted great! Really felt comfortable after a lot of walking up and down Duval street. Don't...More

headline: Lives up to the hype!
content: Sloppy Joe's was everything I had imagined it to be. Everyone has heard of it, but not everyone gets a chance to actually be there, and it did not disappoint. It is definitely set up to handle crowds off the street. Service was great as...More

headline: You Just Gotta Go Once
content: This was on our list of must see places.  We ordered the Original Sloppy Joe and it was ok.  The Pain in the As* Pina Colada was pretty darn good.  The Sloppy Mojito was ok. The entertainment was good.  They kept ringing a cowbell and...More

headline: If  you want a feel for Key West, this is the place to go
content: I was here with my husband during bike week.  Although the place was packed there was still great service and food.  My husband had the sloppy Joe and loved it.  But what I love most about this place is the ambience!  We visited at night...More

headline: Good Food & Fun Atmosphere
content: We really enjoyed the food here - shared a Sloppy Joe, Fries, and Wings.  Pretty good, just bar food - nothing to get all excited about.  Live music was incredibly entertaining! Typical tourist trap but we had to do it!  We intended to go to...More

headline: GOOD FOOD & GREAT LIVE MUSIC
content: Ribs are good Sloppy of course and why not. Service is good always alot of fun here

headline: Gotta Go to Joe's
content: We were hesitant to go to Sloppy Joe's because we thought it was just a tourist-trap!  We were wrong.  Sloppy Joe's is a funky bar with great beer on tap and fun drinks.  We had the original Sloppy Joe sandwich which was a mess, but...More

headline: A Key West MUST!
content: Been stopping here for years. A classic Key West spot! The food is decent, but the atmosphere is great! A lot of fun!!

headline: True to Legend!
content: Stopped in for drinks and appetizers in the afternoon during a jam session.  Everyone was friendly and the service was good.  Great experience and a must see!

headline: Food Better Than Expected
content: We wandered into Sloppy Joes thinking we would just have a few drinks and see the show.  But we got hungry and decided to try some food.  My wife had the Greek salad which was large and very flavorful.  I had the cheesburger with fries...More

headline: Fun place!
content: A must go to restaurant in Key West!  We went on a rainy afternoon the sloppy go sandwich and beer hit the spot.  2 very funny were comics were they.  Very Fun place!

headline: If you are at Key West you need to go to Sloppy Joe's!
content: Everytime we visit Key West we always make sure we spend some time at Sloopy Joe's. This is a one of a kind restaurant and if you are at Key West you need to visit it for sure. Hemingwway was a frequent visitor there, even...More

headline: Great fun
content: Total Dive Bar with good music and the Sloppy Joe's are awesome!!

headline: Great band
content: The band was incredible, the atmosphere was great.  Very busy but everyone was having a blast.

headline: Tourist Spot
content: I suppose you have to do it, but don't eat there, the food is mediocre at best, but the place is packed at night, with loud, live music. Keep in mind this is NOT the Sloppy Joe's that Hemingway frequented, which is a half block...More

headline: FANTASTIC PARTY JOINT
content: Visiting Sloppy Joe's is a must do event.  I had a wonderful time just meeting nice people and enjoying the band.

headline: You have to go to Sloppy Joe's
content: Something you have to do when you are in Key West. Drinks and food were just average. Atmosphere was lively and the entertainment was good. We had a good time. Glad we went, but probably won't go again.

headline: Taproom!
content: My husband and I visited last week during the rainstorms so we found shelter in a quiet little bar behind Sloppy Joes, Joes Taproom. The tap selection was fun to try, we had to get the sloppy Joe ofcourse! It was good, but a little...More

headline: drinks only
content: my wife and i went to sloppy joe's this past week, and i got to say the food sucked. my wife ordered shrimp, and you could tell they just dumped them from the box, i had a hamburger that was nothing to write home about...More

headline: Surprisingly Good
content: I was very hesitant to go here because it was so ‚Äòtouristy‚Äô.  I usually like to go where the locals go and find places off the beaten path.  However when the streets are flooded and you get a bit water logged you are surprised any...More

headline: Good Music Fun Place To Spend Some Time
content: We stopped at Sloppy Joe's because of it's reputation as a Key West landmark.  We found the last 2 seats at the bar.  The service was fast and the the bartender was very busy but kept checking on us. We had draft beer only. There...More

headline: My favorite bar in KW
content: My favorite bar that we visited in Key West - fast service, strong drinks and great live music. It was pouring rain the whole time we were there, but that didn't stop the party at Joes!

headline: Must go
content: Sloppy Joe's is a must-go-to place in Key West.  We stopped in mid-afternoon after walking all day, sightseeing.  We ordered a drink and a sloppy joe to share for a little "happy hour" snack.  WOW! Best sloppy joe we've ever had and the pours in...More

headline: Fun as hell!
content: My husband and i were bar hopping and the act on stage caught our attention. We saw Pete and Wang perform and found ourselves laughing so hard we didn't want to leave. Great atmosphere:-)

headline: Live music and three bars
content: The center bar is always crowded. Try the one closest to the stage or the other small one.you'll get quicker service. The small bars don't serve the wait staff. Look for the drink menu hanging above each bar. Seasonal beers are written on a chalk...More

headline: Live Music and good Food
content: We stopped in one afternoon to listen to a live band.  It was so much fun and the band was great!  We decided to eat and we were surprised how good the food was in a bar in Key West.  We thought the food was...More

headline: Delish
content: Good resturante with reasonable prices and live entertainment at lunch.  Beer was COLD. Had a wonderful experience and would go back any wtime I'm in Cozumel

headline: Fair at best. Lots of better choices.
content: Sloppy Joes is one of those things you just have to do your first time in Key West.  And when you do, you'll notice that there aren't any locals there.  There's a reason for that.  Sloppy's is a huge tourist draw and they never lack...More

headline: An Ok Experience
content: Have been to Sloppy Joe's a couple times before.  I also ask myself why I stopped there.  At $4.25 for a domestic beer, hardly seems worth the experience.  If folks just want to say they've been there, just walk through the bar and leave.  You...More

headline: Had a Great time
content: It was very busy but was a typical bar/live music scene.  Dancing, live cover bands and yummy drinks.  Like I said it was BUSY and at times hard to get the waitress/bar tender.

headline: Go for ambiance, not service
content: My mom wanted to go the  famous Sloppy Joes on her 60th birthday this past Monday.   The ambiance was what we expected but our server was horrible.   Carie was the worst server we had our entire trip in Key West.  We had to ask her...More

headline: Great food, great fun!!!
content: This was our second vacation in Key West, both times we have visited Sloppy Joe's...can't wait to go back again. Both times I have had the "to die for" sloppy joe Quesadilla. Comes with sour cream and salsa. It was excellent! Seems like they stopped...More

headline: Great local color, fun place, a landmark you definitely should visit!
content: Had a great time.  Wanted to stop in just to see the place since Hemingway was a frequent customer.  Ordered a fruity drink for my wife and a draft for me, met some great folks from London at the bar, found the webcam on the...More

headline: Gimme some more of that Sloppy Joe's sauce!
content:
It's not a restaurant. It's not a cafe. It's not a bar. It's not a dance room (though supposedly once it was). Ernest Hemingway made up the name.

I had the burger. And then I had the fries. With sauce. Lot's of it. And it...More

headline: Best Burger in Key West
content: The place to stop on a hot August day in Key West. Ice cold beer and the best burger and fries in Key West.  Wait staff was fast and friendly - bartenders sensed when you were ready for another and delivered as if programmed.  Plenty...More

headline: You probably have to have a beer here because it is expected
content: One of many places on Duval Street, and normally a place that serves beer in plastic cups would not get a recommendation to visit. However, Sloppy Joes gets a visit recommendation. Stop in for a beer and people watch; sit near an entrance so you...More

headline: The infamous Sloppy Joe's was GREAT!
content: The infamous Sloppy Joe's was GREAT! Sat us immediately. Got a table right next to the stage where there was a live performance. Great atmosphere, great food, great service! Will definitely go back again!

headline: Great Place! Will go back again!
content: The infamous Sloppy Joe's was GREAT! Sat us immediately. Got a table right next to the stage where there was a live performance. Great atmosphere, great food, great service! Will definitely go back again!

headline: If this wasn't such a tradition, I would have given it 1 star!
content:
Okay, this is getting 2 stars just because the food was okay and you can't diss Earnest Hemmingway's hangout.  

If that wasn't a factor, the service sucked.  Our server took our order and that was it.  She never came back to check on how our...More

headline: Cool place
content: Cool bar with live music. Had good drinks and did I mention that Hemmingway hung out here.

headline: salty sloppy joe!
content: The place is good for the sloppy joe's. yeah it was meaty and sloppy and delicious. But i think the main element in the sloppy joe was SALT !!! Way too much of it! Make sure you have some sorta drink on hand because you'll...More

headline: Just good fun!
content: Just had drinks and listed to music late at night.  Great band, made you want to sing along.  Great people watching.

headline: Nice place, live music, good food!
content: Stopped by for lunch - right on lively Duval street, pretty popular (as it's crowded), live music playing (he was a singer with a guitar, but played some really lovely songs). We tried their Original Sloppy Joe sandwich which was good. The Tortilla chips with...More

headline: Old Key West bar
content: This bar/restaurant is all about the experience. Every tour you go on talks about Sloppy Joe's. Lots have happened here over the years. There is always live bands playing for your enjoyment.

headline: One Loud Party
content: It‚Äôs the one place that will always have people in it. It‚Äôs a tourist attraction that everyone wants to see once. The food is okay and the drinks are plentiful. The music can be hit or miss depending on when you go.

headline: MUST DO!!  An old Ernest Hemmingway hangout, a KW TRADITION!
content: Sloppy Joe's has been located at the Corner of Greene and Duval streets since 1937.  Our tram tour told us that Ernest Hemingway used to hang out at the bar and write, it was supposed to be one of his favorite places.  They hold "Ernest...More

headline: love the fritters
content: I love there conch fritters its a must have when in key west. they have simple food that will please everyone even picky eaters. service was good and fast its close to shopping and they have a souvenir shop also.

headline: It's my favorite, I just can't help it...
content: This place is just great. I love it, plain and simple. They have great frozen drinks, nice pours on cocktails, mid-top shelf for the wells, and great food.  The music is the right level and style and seems to be live on a pretty regular...More

headline: Try to go super early or really late.
content: This place is always packed and since the seating is fend for yourself it is easier to get a seat when it is less crowded. I went at 11Am before lunch time and it was perfect because we were served right away. Around 1145 the...More

headline: A Key West Tradition!
content: We have been to Key West many times and had never actually stepped inside Sloppy Joe's until our trip this year! We didn't know what we were missing! I knew we had to try the sloppy joe at Sloppy Joe's, and I chose to have...More

headline: Nice old bar, fun atmosphere, good drinks
content: We stopped to cool off our first day, got a beer and a pina colada. Very good frozen drink.  Of course got the T-shirts. Didn't stay long. Love the open concept of the bar because it's not so smoky.  We were able to get a...More

headline: Don't order the hamburger
content: It's Sloppy Joe's. OK? A landmark. Go there. Just DON'T get the burger. VERY dissapointing. We're talking Sam's Club BS patties on a bun. The Fish Taco's were good. We expected that a Sloppy Joe's Burger would be big and juicy. Sadly, NO. Skinny and...More

headline: Everything You want from a night spot in Key West:
content:
THE PRO'S:

1) The Food:   We had The Sloppy Joe's & they were AMAZING!  Do not attempt to pick them up out of the basket they are served in.  Use a fork & knife....You've been warned!  LOL!
2) The Atmosphere:  It's great!  Whether you want...More

headline: Go when there are no cruise ships in port.
content:
Go, order the pulled pork sandwich, the greek salad[one of the best], and a good beer.  Listen to the music, and look for Bone Island Brett, thats me, say hi.

Good time if not crowded with crazy people.

headline: Good food and good prices.
content: You seat yourself and it's usually busy so be prepared. We had good service and some of the best prices for very good food. The pulled pork sandwich was excellent.

headline: It was okay.
content: The sloppy Jo's were okay. They were good and had a very sweet taste to them. We also order fries with cheese and bacon on it and they were okay as well. The atmosphere is fairly neat. But overall it is not something I would...More

headline: Key West Classic
content:
Live music at lunchtime during the week. Very casual and fun. Food was good but not the best in 
Key West.

headline: Good food!
content: The food was really good.  Would not recommend for young children.  The bands songs could take a lot of explaining.

headline: Your Key West pitstop for drinks and a dose of Hemmingway kitsch
content:
Its a nice place to get out of the sun, sit down and get some drinks. Placement is good, on northern end of Duval street, it drew a good crowd.

It's a big street corner bar with much of its facade open to the street,...More

headline: Don't waste your time
content: Service was poor.  It was really busy, but table turn-over is quick and we got a table after only 5 minutes.  I think it's because no one can stand the poor service.  There was only one guy working who actually looked happy to be alive....More

headline: A very fun place!
content: My new husband and I went to Sloppy Joe's and it is a very fun place to go while in Key West!  We didn't eat there, but the food did look good, but had drinks and had a GREAT time and great drinks! A must...More

headline: Ok, more tourist hype than greatness
content: The food was just barely ok.  We ordered the Sloppy Joe's Nachos and a Sloppy Joe sandwich.  Live music was ok, at least the place is large enough that the music isn't too loud to enjoy.  I would imagine if you are big drinker, this...More

headline: The food is good, but the entertainment is better!
content:
We went to Sloppy Joe's twice while in Key West.  The first time was because it's just something you have to do, but the second time was because we had such a great time the first time!

On our first visit we had sloppy joes,...More

headline: Pete and Wayne
content: We went to Sloppy Joes and had a mix of beers and frozen cocktails. We ordered boneless buffalo wings and when they came out they had bones in them. We didn't send them back because we were too hungry. The entertainment was Pete and Wayne...More

headline: Pleasantly surprised.....
content: I expected overpriced, not so great quality food and was pleasantly surprised. The food was above avg bar food and was better than a few of the meals we payed more for during the week. Atmosphere is cool and it's worth a stop on Duval...More

headline: Would not go there again.
content: To go once and check it out for yourself it's OKAY. Very Mediocre... expensive, tasteless entertainment, and the service was terrible. Had the fish tacos... BLEH!! Go to Garbo's Grill for the best fish burritos at a much better price. I will never eat at...More

headline: Nothing special, live music was good
content: Had a group of six, most of us ordered food and all ordered drinks. Our waitress was one of the nicest ones we had all weekend!! The beers were cold, had the signature sloppy margarita, nothing special, not even in the top ten but clearly...More

headline: Good vibe.
content: My husband and i stopped here for lunch while in Key West.  The place was packed, but we were able to get a seat right next to the stage.  There was a performer there singing.  I was nervous about being right next to the stage,...More

headline: You gotta go.....
content: The food is nothing to write home about but the drinks, band and the atmosphere are all good.   Go and have a good time just eat elsewhere.

headline: Go to say you went!
content: Was the food GREAT?  No, but I didn't find ANY GREAT food in Florida!  The atmosphere in Sloppy Joes was GREAT!  The live band was great!  And the Pina Colada was great!  They have a shop with souvenir tshirts, ice scrapers, coffee mugs and much...More

headline: Great meal-reasonable prices
content: Went to sloppy joes for lunch. The food was very good. The portions were big. The prices were very reasonable for Key West. A must do if your in Key West!!!

headline: We had such a great time, so we went back another night!
content: Key West has a lot of nightlife and live music everywhere, but we found ourselves returning to Sloppy Joe's.  The live bands there got people out on the dancefloor!  We had so much fun dancing one night that we went back another night for more...More

headline: The only place to be!!!!!!!
content: We love this bar.  Each night we would plan to go other places but always ended back here!  Even with the same band playing for the week, we hung out at Sloppy Joe's almost every night.  The people and atmosphere are great.  Also the dj...More

headline: Perfect place to unwind
content: After visiting the Hemingway home, it only seemed fitting that we should head over to Sloppy Joe's. It's self-seating and if you go at a busy time, it can be a bit of a waiting game to find a table. Once you do though, it's...More

headline: One of those places you just have to go to in Key West.
content: Always lots of action here. Always a band playing, and lots of people.  Good, standard bar food - nothing outstanding, but everything we had was good.

headline: Fun place and good food
content: Stopped by here on our first night and tried the sloppy joe's and wings.  Surprisingly good on both parts.  Stayed later for the band and had a very fun time.  Sylvia the waitress is amazing!  Kept bringing us pitchers of waters even after we paid...More

headline: Don't Waste Your Time
content: No specials.  Expensive drinks.  Rude bartenders.  Lame entertainment.  If any of these appeal to you, definitely stop by here.  Otherwise, go somewhere else.

headline: Great Bar
content: Sloppy Joe's is great nightlife.  They have cold beer and very strong drinks at reasonable prices.  Both times we have been, there has been a good band playing too.  A must see.

headline: The best nachos I ever had with a side of Sloppy Joe!
content: Go for the history, stay for the food.  Bar food done really well, great beers, live entertainment.  Seriously the best nachos I ever had.  And the Joe is great.

headline: great sloppy joe sandwich
content: We really enjoyed the entertainment, drinks and a great sloppy joe sandwich.

headline: A pub filled with history!
content: If you're looking for a loud yet interesting bar,go to Sloppy joe's. this was Ernest hemmingway's hang out back in the days,so it's filled with history. try out the drink papa doubbles!

headline: Fun
content: We had a blast! There was a family of six band and they rocked the house!!!

headline: Stopping into Sloppy Joe's is a no brainer on every trip to KW.
content: My wife loves the slopy joes at Sloppy Joe's so I really have no choice on going here or not. Luckily I also like the food. In the past I have stuck to having the sloppy joe. But over heard a local mention their chili...More

headline: Always a must see.
content:
The best food in the place is called a SLEDGEHAMMER!
Like people say though - people watching, the atmosphere, and the drinks are what it's all about.
A must every time we visit.

headline: Must see if you're visiting Key West!
content: You have to stop here if you're visiting Key West! The food is OK but it's really the history and atmosphere that bring people in. We saw the Pete & Wayne show while we ate and they were hysterical! The entertainment is for adults only...More

headline: Cold beer, good food and great live music!
content: This place has a great atmosphere and has excellent service.  Food is very good and they offer a good selection of beers.  If you enjoy live music - sit near the stage.  We saw two great acts while we were in Key West - the...More

headline: A must if visiting Key West!
content: If you have limited time visiting Key West, you should not miss visiting, and/or eating at Sloppy Joe's restaurant.  It has very good food and live entertainment.  The inside dining area has various pictures on the walls such as Hemingway, and has large mounted fish...More

headline: Don't go for the food!
content: Went there last year, so don't remember particulars about service.  What I do remember was the food was lousy.  Don't waste any time eating here! Sadly we wasted a whole meal here.  Go for the music & drinking, but definitely NOT for the food.

headline: Awesome Live Music
content: We were in Key West for the night and went to Sloppy Joes for a few drinks. We had a blast. The crowd was fun, the drinks great and the music out of control.  ‚ÄúNever In Vegas‚Äù was the Saturday February 19th talent and all...More

headline: just ok...
content: there was nothing special about this place - i guess it really depends on if they have good entertainment that day or not.  typical menu, typical service, typical below average bar food.  just nothing special here - but nothing bad either.  it was a great...More

headline: Great bawdy bar; don't order the food
content: Excellent cold beer at reasonable prices...check out the tap room.  The singing is on the raw side but lots of fun.  Under no circumstances, order a burger or fish sandwich...burger and sandwich were served just warm, comes with no sides, slice of cheese (Kraft AMerican)...More

headline: Napoleon Behind the bar
content: If you are looking for the ignorance of yesterday then this is your place.  I cleaned the wet bar with one too many napkins and found myself outside looking for my wife.  Education is the basic virtue in life unless you aply for a job...More

headline: Great Live Music
content:
Best live music in Key West.  Went twice while I was there for a week- one night salsa and the other a kind of comedy folksy group.  Both were excellent.  

 I recommend the Sloppy Rita.  Yum!

headline: It's Sloppy Joe's!  You have to stop in!
content:
I almost walked out to tell you the truth.  But my husband wanted to stay.  
And I realized it's its a bar.  Its smelly (like booze and smoke), gets crowed, and yes can be very loud!  But its a KW staple.  You can find locals...More

headline: Didn't care for it
content: The food was cold, but so was the beer! Service was great. The music was really, really raunchy. I didn't care for this place at all. Too touristy for me.

headline: Oh NO! Not another "Hemingway Drank Here"! But it turns out it's a great Key West Tradition!
content: Yes he did, apparently.  Joe Russel (the "Joe" according to folklore) who owned it was a long-time fishing bud of Hemingway.  Hemingway and others spent a fair bit of time imbibing, philosophizing and solving the world's problems, in Sloppy Joe's.  Being our first time in...More

headline: Sloppy Joe's
content: What can I say about Sloppy Joe's? Not enough to cover this page! And there is nothing sloppy about Joe either. The doors are wide open for everyone of all nationalities. They love everyone equally with the decor of world flags on the ceiling. You'll...More

headline: Absolute must for any Key West trip
content: Obviously lots of history, and hype before we came, but very glad we did.  Ate lunch on Monday.  It was busy, (2 cruise boats in dock), but not overbearing, we had no trouble just walking right in.  Food was very good for a bar, huge...More

headline: Tourist must
content: It's a bar! Of course its loud, of course service is slow. Yup some guy will probably even spill his drink on you the drunkingly appologize and stunmle off. The staff are kinda friendly, it kinda smells like stale beer and old cigarettes, but IT'S...More

headline: Went for the Sloppy Joe, Stayed for the Music and Dancing
content: The Sloppy Joe was delicious, served in less than 5 minutes, just like you'd expect it.  Sure $9 is a lot for a sloppy joe but it's on Duval St in Key West so that's par for the course.  The rest of the menu was...More

headline: If you must, go there and have a drink, but don't eat the food
content: Of course we had heard that this place is where Hemingway used to hang out, though apparently the *original* Sloppy Joe's is down the street. That said, I had what was probably the worst salad I've ever been served. How is it possible to ruin...More

headline: Fun place
content: Live cam cool.  Delicious sloppy joe. Awesome buffalo shrimp.

headline: Sloppy Joes - a big bar with a band.
content:
We stopped for a bite and a few drinks in Sloppy Joe's, because you have to surely?
Anyway we had fairly standard burger type food and sat and watched the band, who were mildly amusing. I saw some older people walk in, listen to a...More

headline: Great Live Music and relaxed atmosphere
content:
Sloppy Joes is our favorite bar in Key West. Everytime we are there we make sure we have enough time to catch one of the concerts of Pete and Wayne. These guys are great fun!
Beers are cold and plenty and finger food is great....More

headline: ok food, nice atmosphere
content: Food wasn't anything special.  We had soggy conch fritters, a fried fish sandwich and chicken sandwich that were average for lunch.  We did enjoy the live music and laid back atmosphere.

headline: great night life
content: On a recent trip to Key West my wife and I were looking for a place to spend our evenings. After visiting many places on and off Duval we always ended up at Sloppy Joe's.  The food was ok but the beer was cold, the...More

headline: Horrible food
content:
Food was so salty. We had the chilli and just couldnt finish it as there was so much salt in there and we also had a steak sandwich it was horrible.
Good atmosphere though.

headline: A Must See!
content: The food and entertainment was excellent. The waitress was excellent as was the atmosphere. I had the opportunity to meet the manager who was very pleasant and helpful.

headline: Great Place to Chill Out
content:
Yes...it's touristy. Yes, my margarita was a bit pricey and served in a plastic cup.

BUT - this is still a great place to sit, relax, listen to some great live music, and enjoy the ambiance of Key West. It has a great location, and...More

headline: Love this place!
content: My cousin and I stopped here while on a cruise and it was so much fun!  We weren't exactly sure what to expect but the people and atmosphere were great.  Food was pretty decent, just typical bar food, but the live performer playing his guitar...More

headline: OK food, nice atmosphere...
content: Went for a late afternoon snack between adventures, food was OK.  Hubby had chicken fingers, said the hot sauce was amazing, lots of flavor with some heat, not so hot it burned more than added flavor.  I had a chicken quesedilla (sp?), chicken had really...More

headline: Good food, good atmosphere, little pricey
content: They had a live band, very loud if you like that atmosphere. The food was good! Best sloppy Joe I;ve ever had. The biggest downfall was the prices. The Sloppy Joe which is just ground meat and a bun was almost $10 and did not...More

headline: Just an average bar serving drinks in plastic cups...
content:
Regular bar food, regular bar bands playing the same covers heard anywhere, and been-there-done-that merchandise.  If you never heard of this place, nor cared about its history, you probably wouldn't give it any cranial storage afterward.

What they did RIGHT:

- No waiting if seating...More

headline: Not what I expected
content: Like a prior review, it is similar to a Hard Rock Cafe in a smaller Key West version.  Tons of atmosphere and very loud.  We were there on a Tuesday afternoon for lunch. The food and service were GREAT! Prices a bit on the step...More

headline: The Hard Rock of Paradise...
content: Sloppy Joe's is a Key West institution and while it serves passable pub grub, you're really there for the ambiance and merchandise. Entertainment abounds on an elevated stage from morning to morning. During the day tourists and families shule in with strollers trying the namesake...More

headline: Best Bar in Key West!
content: Sloppy Joes is so much fun!  The bar tenders & security employees are so nice!  We had a great time.  The drinks are kind of expensive and we did not eat here, but the bar is fun!

headline: good for drinks not for dining
content: The food isn't worth it but its a must hit for bar hopping

headline: Typical Bar food.
content: We ate lunch at Sloppy Joe's.  Our food was decent, but nothing spectacular.  The food was no different typical bar food you can get anywhere.  The drinks were very good.  Overall if you are looking for a local establishment with typical pub fare, this is...More

headline: delicious frozen drinks on a hot day
content: you cant go wrong stopping here for a frozen drink topped with 151 alcohol! BARGAIN! live music and awesome staff! you can even see yourself on the live web cam.  We did not eat here so I cant say anything about the food but I...More

headline: Fun atmosphere
content: Didn't eat there, but had a few drinks. I've seen some other reviews where they say drinks didn't have much alcohol...MINE DID! Holy tequila margarita!!!  :) Fun atmosphere, but didn't stay long...too loud for being sober!

headline: Great bar- fun- ok bar food
content: This is a tourist "must" for Key West.  Fun music all the time.  We had some bar food.  It was good.  The drinks were a little expensive without a lot of alcohol.  Stick with beer.

headline: Dont bother
content: Place has become such a tourist trap. Food is horrible and overpriced. Its smelly and the loud music is not only too loud the bands are sucky.. oh yeah and beer is a rip too.. trust me your not missing out. Go once to "see"...More

headline: Great bar with great entertainment
content: We always drop into Sloppy Joes, went in on Tuesday night when we heard the 80‚Äôs band the Deloreans playing, music and atmosphere was so great we stayed and closed the place. Went back a couple nights later and listened for a set again. Always...More

headline: Good Bar!
content: Stopped by this bar three times during our visit.  The drinks and food (sloppy joes & hot dogs) were good, as well as the live entertainment.  From our table we could also people watch on Duvall street.

headline: Don't get the food
content: S. Joe's is a fun bar but we made the mistake of having dinner there.  I had a "taco salad" .  It consisted of lettuce, tomatoes, black bean and onions.  I asked for no olives.  There was a small pile of tortilla chips on the...More

headline: Keeps changing for the worst
content: I have been going to Key West for longer than most people except the locals.  Sloppy Joes has the atmosphere, and the locals for entertainment are great.  However every year I go  back,  it gets more and more for the crusise ship people.   Now it...More

headline: Mediocre food and live band.
content: Of course while in Key West we had to visit this must see spot. It is not must see, it's bar food with tourist priced drinks with a name brand bringing guests in.  Our waitress was nice but slow, the food was not anything great...More

headline: Lively bar, good atmosphere and live music!
content: We really enjoyed our first experience in Sloppy Joe's.  Lots of people having fun and letting their hair down!  It seemed to be the liveliest place in Key West, great music and lots of dancing!

headline: FUN
content: If you do nothing else on a trip to Key West, you HAVE to eat a sloppy joe at Sloppy Joe's!!  Also, they have have great t-shirts.

headline: a MUST in Key West
content:
Great drinks, great scene, live is sometimes questionable - but there is usually no cover - so who cares!
You have to stop and have a drink at this place, if you head to KW. As with most places in the world, Hemingway drank here!....Just...More

headline: Not the Original One, but Fun Anyway
content: Although the real Sloppy Joe's where Hemingway hung out is across the street and now is called Captain Tony's, this location gets all the notoriety that comes with the name.  Self-serve seating is inconvenient because it's always packed and ten people all race for a...More

headline: Sloppy Joes offends decent people
content: This was our third trip to Sloppy Joes and we will never go there again.  This time we brought friends with us, expecting pretty good food and the fun atmosphere we had experienced in years past.  As the band sang songs with indecent and vulgar...More

headline: Enjoyed the Beer, Band, Quesadilla.
content:
We were in Key West the weekend before Super Bowl, and decided to channel our inner Hemingway (it was the esteemed author's favorite during his Key West years) at the bar.
 There was a good crowd early Sunday night, and the Pro Bowl was on...More

headline: Wild and crazy bar
content: Good bar food, great drinks, terrific service, wonderful entertainment

headline: Fun place in Key West
content: This is a great place for the atmosphere of Key West! I have been here many times and have not had one bad experience. I typically sit at the bar and enjoy the live music with my husband. The entertainer is very interactive and usually...More

headline: Good food & atmosphere, but big $$, too
content: We HAD to do Sloppy Joe's, lest we be considered lacking tourist skills. It was a loud, fun bar with live music. We had 2 sloppy joes (which were much larger than I expected), conch fritters, and a quesadilla, and for the entire table I...More

headline: Make sure and stop at Sloppy Joe's - fun place.
content: Food was good, singer/band was lively. We were there for lunch and it was busy. Bought a T-shirt. It is a fun place.

headline: Best place in Key West, last civilized place in the world
content: Best, Best bar on Duval Street to hang out,  drink, enjoy the local entertainment, enjoy the tourists, enjoy the weather.   Inside is great with things from 80 years ago or more. Food is great, everyone is friendly, and everybody is friends.  Go in soak up...More

headline: Food F, Atmosphere B+, Service C-, Mixed drinks F
content:
Skip this place for food. It was just terrible.

The food is gross! Its all food that they microwave then bring to your table. Even the fried items were microwaved and chewy. I didn't even finish my dinner it was so bad.

The service was...More

headline: Funkey Bar.  Nuff said
content: Go for the alcohol.  Stay away from the food.  Over the last 10 years going to KW we have tried Sloppy Joe's.  Never have we been satisfied with the food.  Small portions bland taste.  Don't buy into the hype about ordering the sloppy joe sandwich/big...More

headline: Not impressed
content: We ate here on our first night in Key West. The atmosphere was fun. They have live music and the band playing was pretty good. They were drinking while they were playing and I think one guy in the band was already pretty lit up....More

headline: Fun Key West Restaurant!
content: We got a Sloppy Joe, some pretzels, and a half pound of shrimp - odd combo I know, but we just wanted to try the place out. We absolutely loved it! The shrimp and Sloppy Joe were both perfect.. A perfectly fun restaurant as well..

headline: Excellent sandwich, terrible service and music
content: We ate here for lunch after visiting a nearby museum.  We wanted to try the famous original sloppy joe sandwich.  Evenings we'd walked by previously, it was always full, but for some reason this day it was quite empty.  We sat ourselves, per the signs,...More

headline: Fun place for drinks and live music
content: I am a HUGE Sloppy Joe fan!  I just love EATING them and making them from scratch, (The Silver Palette has an EXCELLENT recipe) so I HAD to try the "real" thing.  I must say that I was disappointed.  The recipe is just too sweet...More

headline: Yes, I know everyone must go there; but, actually the food was great!
content: The must go to place in Key West surprised us with very good food; the Sloppy Joes and Pulled Pork sandwiches were excellent; the noise is well; expected; the service considering the crowd was superb.

headline: Fun Place
content: All around this place is really cool. I think they always have some sort of live entertainment (at least they did each time we walked by) I went in on two different nights.  There always seems to be some sort of bachelorette party or something...More

headline: Don't Miss it! It's a Hoot!!
content:
The reviews on this legendary place, as per usual, fall into two categories, the people who are never pleased, and the happy folks.

If you fall into the first category, are morose, picky and never have a good time, avoid this wonderful place like the...More

headline: Good food, good atmosphere
content: Good food, good atmosphere! Never know who you might see while you're there!! :)

headline: Must Go To Sloppy Joes ---- but don't eat there!
content: My husband and I have eaten twice at Sloppy Joes ---- once during a previous visit a few years ago and then again recently. The food was passable a few years ago, but not this time. Service was slow. Food quality was poor and small...More

headline: Fun Time at Sloppy Joe's
content: My boyfriend and I heard mixed reviews about Sloppy Joe's. Some people said we must go there and others said that we should just walk in and walk out and tell people that we were there. Despite what was said, we decided to go to...More

headline: Mainly a drinks place, wouldn't go for the food again.
content: Before my experience there, I was all hyped about going to Sloppy Joe's, but in all honesty, it's nothing that special...just a bar with overpriced food and live music. It's seat-yourself style, so my boyfriend and I found a little table in the back beside...More

headline: Not for kids!!
content: I know it says Sloppy Joes bar but we went by at noon and there were kids with their parents in there so we decided to eat dinner there.  We came back around 5:00.  It was very crowded but we found a place.  There was...More

headline: Expensive, Great Music, Great Sloppy-Rita.
content: Sloppy Joe's is obviously a tourist trap, with way overpriced drinks. But you know what? It was a blast. We say some great rock and roll bands, had some great mixed drinks, and really enjoyed ourselves. My wife and I drank there most of one...More

headline: Overpriced, Loud, Food Nothing Special.
content: This place must make an absolute fortune.  The Sloppy Joe sandwich was $8.50 -- and that is just for a bun and some meat slopped out of a giant pot.  No fries.  No sides.  Nothing but the sandwich.  Fries were an additional $4 or something....More

headline: GREAT SLOPPY JOE'S
content: We had a great lunch ... the service was slow  but we did enjoy our food.      We are glad that we went there once ... but it won't be on our "must return" list.  The place is dingy and needs a good clean-up.

headline: Just to say you've been there
content:
We were on a cruise and our first port stop was in Key West. I have several  family members who go there frequently and EVERYONE has heard of Sloppy Joe's!
The place is a little on the dingy side, but believe it or not that...More

headline: Over priced!
content:
Definately you are paying for the history I guess. Cost two $38 to eat lunch.
Had a Sloppy Joe and a BLT wrap with Fries, sodas and two beers.....$38.
Would recommend only for the history but watch out for the cost of the food as...More

headline: The name says it all.
content: I always have to have a slopy joe when I come to Key West. This is a fun place, great for families. Very reasonable and it is what it is.

headline: Sloppy makes for fun!
content:
Looking for a party and some laid back grub? This is your dig!
This place is legendary and is a MUST see. We went there many times but never ordered the namesake sandwich. It is a do not miss!! Order that sloppy joe (which is...More

headline: What's all the hype?
content: The 'famous' sloppy joe sandwich is way overpriced. It didn't come w/any sides. The drink I got was a mix of strawberry daiquiri and pina colada - too sweet. Service was quick.

headline: Fun bar with history
content: For an historic landmark they serve up good, if only typical, bar food.  The selection is good, the music is live and loud, and its close to the heart of the night life.

headline: A tourist trap, but what the heck...
content: Yes, Sloppy Joe's is a tourist trap (but what Key West place is not?). The drinks come ready-made in plastic cups out of a freezer. No bartender could mix a real mojito (after all, that WAS Hemingway's favourite drink), in fact I don't think there...More

headline: A Key West Institution
content: I don't eat here, but you have to stop, buy a drink and look around.  It's like a museum with alcohol - can't beat that!  This trip I discovered the smaller bar off the back  (can't remember the name) with a little porch where you...More

headline: Pete and Wayne in Key West at Sloppy Joe's
content:
These guys are like Mark Twain, Walt Whitman (well, OK, not Walt), Lennie Bruce and any other obscene commentator on American culture of any revelance in the last 200 years. 

I don't normally like entertainers where I have to pay attention but the wit, humor...More

headline: You have to go -- What's Key West without it!?
content: Really fun bar. Friendly staff.  Food choice is standard bar food, but the taste is above that. Nice place to go to have a good time. They seem to work hard to make sure you are enjoying yourself -- a lot of places with name...More

headline: An Interesting Bar With A Famous Name!
content:
My wife and I had a few drinks at Sloppy Joe's while recently in Key West. It is what it is, a large room with lots of tables, a bar, plenty of beer and lots of people talking and having fun. 

It isn't the orignal...More

headline: Try the Full Moon Fish Sandwich
content: I know Sloppys is not thought of as a decent place for food...that it simply caters to tourists and cruise ship folks...but I consider myself a fish sandwich expert, and I LOVE the Full Moon fish sandwich here...PLUS it has a real history, having been...More

headline: Can't wait to go back!
content: My husband and I visited Key West the last week of November. This was our first trip there but our friends told us we defenitely had to check out Sloppy Joes and boy are we happy we did!  Our first night in there we had...More

headline: I have to se that place...
content: I have to se that place YES

headline: Key West's biggest attraction
content:
No matter what we did, this is where we ended up at night.  We went to other bars, but before we knew it we were back at Sloppy Joe's.

Probably the biggest bar in Key West.  Three separate bars that I can remember, a large...More

headline: A Legend In Key West
content: No visit to Key West is complete without a visit to Sloppy Joe's, a former hangout for Ernest Hemingway.  We were there for lunch on 9/29/2008 and risked our lives eating the barbequed pork and cheese laden french fries.  They were cholesteral heaven and my...More

headline: brillant, till 4 am
content: brillant, till 4 am

headline: Lou great bartender
content: You got to hit the back bar on Thursday afternoon. Lou the bartender is a barrel of laughs. Great time gauranteed.

headline: A Legend....you should come here at least once!
content:
We stayed this summer in Key West for four nights. Of course a visit in Sloppy Joe's had to be done.

You really can't miss this place, if you are around Duval Street you'll see and hear it.
We just came in here for a...More

headline: Very Fun
content: Good food, not much exceptional about it, but the atmosphere adds a lot.  Would definately go back.

headline: You don't go for the food or quiet conversation. You go to see and be seen.
content: You don't go for the food or quiet conversation. You go to see and be seen.

headline: Great Atmosphere
content: This is a great place for a night with friends. We went with our teenage kids, met friends and had a wonderful time. It's always busy and has a great atmosphere. The live music is always good (we've been here many times before), the food...More

headline: Good bar for lunch
content: Good food. Helpful and attentive waitstaff. Live entertainment. It can be hard to find a table during lunchtime but just hang a bit and the wait will be worth it. The rum runners are a refreshing blast of coolness after walking in the heat though...More

headline: a must visit to take in...
content: a must visit to take in the true vibe of key west

headline: Worst Food in Southern Florida
content: While the atmosphere was entertaining, there are other places to be entertained where you will be able to eat the food.  My wife ordered the sloppy joe, and I ordered the pulled pork and onion rings; the food was just plain gross.  If you are...More

headline: Sloppy Joe's
content: This was a cool place to eat lunch. It is an orginial that has been around in Key West for many years. There is live entertainment with great drinks. The service was fast and friendly. The food was great and a lot of it.

headline: Usually great music
content: Another tradtional stop for our Key West trips.  Usually always crowded, but it has some great bands booked playing all hours.

headline: A really fun bar!
content:
We came to Key West with 2 other couples to see a local New Jersey band, The Juliano Brothers, play at Sloppy Joe's in Duval Street from May 29-June 2.

Sloppy Joe's is such a fun bar!  We spent 3 nights there listening to the...More

headline: Great Key West Bar
content: Visited this bar and thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere and entertainment midday during the week.  The pub fare and drinks (especially the Sloppy 'Rita) was great and there was great value for the money!  I will definitely visit this bar again.

headline: Disappointed
content: I really wanted to go to Sloppy Joe's this trip since we never seemed to make it on our last trips. When we got there it had a pretty good crowd. I loved the high ceiling and decor. The entertainer was a blond guy with...More

headline: Sloppy Joes- Fun to drink and surprisingly great food!
content:
If you aren't looking for a loud, bar environment... don't head here.
Sloppy Joe's is a place for the partying type of crowd. Not really an environment for kids...

The place is a blast for anyone, unless of course you aren't 21! 

Sloppy Joe's usually...More

headline: It's an attraction-It's a bar - It's a must do!
content: If you're in Key West, you have to collect the story of Sloppy Joe's and Hemingway, and you have to go there (as well as Cap't Tony's, the original Sloppy Joe's in Hemingway's time).  Yes, it's loud, crowded and busy - but it's a bar...More

headline: Big, Loud and Crowded
content: This is not the cozy little hang out we imagined.  It is one really large, rocking bar that is popular with the younger crowd.  It was always packed with people and the music was pretty loud, either live or recorded.  Nothing wrong with that but,...More

headline: Big, Loud and Crowded
content: This is not the cozy little Hemingway hang out that we imagined.  It is one really large, rocking bar that is popular with the younger crowd.  It was always packed with people and the music was pretty loud, either live or recorded.  Nothing wrong with...More

headline: Couldn't get a seat
content: Can't really give a full review, as we didn't eat here. We tried to, they have a "seat yourself" system, but when there are 40 other tourists waiting for a spot to open up, it becomes a every-man-for-themselves atmosphere. Would it really kill them to...More

headline: ok, thats all
content: okay if you buy into the Key West hype, just another tourist trap, so so food, and too loud. but you can buy a cool t-shirt to show off to your friends up north.

headline: I had to give this one 4...
content: I had to give this one 4 stars simply because of the history and ambiance of the place. Live music, happy vacationers, and good beer make for a memorable experience. My mom and I split a Sloppy Joe (of course) and enjoyed it. My margarita...More

headline: A nice place with live music and good biers!!!
content: A nice place with live music and good biers!!!

headline: Best ritas in KW
content: Be sure to get a Sloppy Rita.  The best in Key West.  Awesome!

headline: Okay but not a MUST DO!
content: The food was ok - nothing bad but nothing great.  The atmosphere was really fun though and I'd reccomend for people to pop by, have a drink and maybe an appetizer just to say they've been.  The Sloppy Joe's are sloppy but good but nothing...More

headline: worst service we ever had
content: food was ok not that great to us   the service we had was the worst we have ever gotten, it alone will stop us from going back  we even had to ask for our check 3 times before we got it, and forget having your...More

headline: Great food, Great atmosphere
content: We stopped in to Sloppy Joes every day of our vacation. It was so nice to get into the air conditioning. My husband had the best chili hot dog he's ever ate, and I had awesome quesadillas. The drinks were always refreshing, and we loved...More

headline: Good restaurant in Key West
content: I visited this place in June of 2007.  I enjoyed my meal - I had the Sloppy Joe.  It wasn't the greatest meal ever, but it was a good lunch and I enjoyed visiting a place famous to Key West.  Also had good frozen drinks....More

headline: they do takeout!
content: rarely can get a table  here but go to the bar and order sloppy Joe's to go and eat at a bench close by.  They do have the best Sloppy Joe's ever!   We were warned that the singer becomes very un- family oriented after about...More

headline: Drinks only
content: We stopped here twice the week of Feb 20th, once to grab a drink in the afternoon, the other to try to get a meal on a Saturday night. Forget anything with food here. Just grab a drink and go.

headline: Overrated
content: We went because everybody told us that "you have to eat at Sloppy Joe's."  It is one of those typical overrated tourist traps!  The sloppy joe sandwich is just that... a sloppy joe sandwich, nothing special!  Each of the two of us ordered a sloppy...More

headline: Bad Bartender Left a Bad Taste
content: My husband and I have been to Sloppy Joes many times before and love the entertainment, especially Pete and Wayne.  On our last trip we sat at the main bar on our trip and were appalled at the service by one of our bartenders.  When...More

headline: Fun Place
content: This is a fun place if you're looking for a lively crowd.  The food was good.  I had a hamburger that was very tasty.  The music was too loud for conversation, but most seemed to be enjoying themselves.

headline: Fun and great food
content: The atmosphere is so much fun, everyone is so friendly, the drinks are great and the food is pretty good, too.  We had the obligatory Sloppy Joe sandwich - it was enormous and very tasty.  They had live music while we were there and it...More

headline: Place To Party, Not To Eat
content:
I enjoyed the atmosphere even though the bartenders act like pre-madonna's.  I understand that several act that way.
We had nachos - awful. This is just a place to hang out and watch the drunks go by.

headline: don't waste your time going here!
content: Yeah, I know it's a landmark, but it isn't even the real bar Hemingway went to!  Overpriced, horrible food & terrible rude service.  Just walk by, that is as close as you want to get.

headline: For Baby Boomers Only
content: If you are in your 20's, do not go here.  My ID was scrutinized like I was 19 again with a fake ID.  That's because once you get in the bar everyone is 40+.  I actually said to my boyfriend "My parents would love this...More

headline: Very Disappointing
content: We've visited SJ's many times and this visit was very disappointing.  We had the nachos which were served stone cold.  We sent them back and the 2nd one was the same way!  The cheese was not even melted on the top.  There were actual shreds...More

headline: Best bar in town
content:
Sloppy Joe's is still the best bar in Key West, with the best entertainment.

Even our 12yr old son rated Pete and Wayne more entertaining than Disney!!

headline: Jack Flat's is better for food
content: Had some beer and burgers here, and it was okay.  Then we visited Jack Flat's 2 blocks away.  Killer Happy Hour- 1/2 lb. burger and beer for $6.  And that burger rocks!  Stopped by for dinner and got the Mahi sandwich.  So awesome.  Prices are...More

headline: First place to go when you get there!
content: Key west would not be Key west without sloppy joe's! The place is Timeless and the service is better than most places on the duval strip! Most places act like your bothering them if you ask for something in key west but sloppy joe's staff...More

headline: Great All Around Hangout Spot!
content: Sloppy Joe's was the most happening place during our stay in Key West the week of Oct. 1st. It was a slow time in Key West, but we could always trust that we would find something going on at Sloppy Joe's. The entertainment was great...More

headline: Great during the day, not so much at night
content: I would suggest going during the day or for an early dinner to say you went to Sloppy Joe's since it is a Key West landmark.  They have regular menu items and yummy drinks you will want to take advantage of, but once it is...More

headline: Great nightly music.
content: My husband and I enjoyed going to Sloppy Joe's for the bands and music played nightly.  They create a large dance floor by moving tables and the staff circulates to bring you drinks if you prefer not to wait at the bar.  June is off...More

headline: A must stop
content: I have been there many times and still enjoy the place. It is considered a bar however the food is actually very good.  On this last trip in June the service and food we received were excellent.  We included this stop several times at lunch...More

headline: OVERRATED? NO WAY!!
content: Thought it would just be another place to say you have been, but no--sooo much fun.  Good bands and good drinks, I had Sloppy Rita's and hubby had beer.  We enjoyed the bartenders and the patrons, too.  We will go back again, and sit at...More

headline: Great place to see and eat at!! Not a real Restaurant but a party place!
content: This is a must see! It is a real party place and gets really crowded at night but has great ambiance for the bar hopper! The food wasnt bad but its not known for that. Its an old style cafe that Hemingway himself used to...More

headline: This is a Bar, not a Restaurant.
content: The next review pretty much sums it up...more of a drinkin' spot than an eatin' spot. Gets crowded & wild, especially when the house band "Wayne & Tom (I think?!) plays. THese guys are VERY funny & know how to get the crowd riled up....More

headline: Sloppy Joe‚Äôs reveiw by CAPTAINRYAN.COM
content: Sloppy Joe‚Äôs has been Key West‚Äôs most famous bar 365 days a year since 1933.  The current Captain Tony‚Äôs was the original home to Sloppy Joe's until May 5, 1937 when owner Joe Russell refused to pay the alarming rent increase of one whole dollar...More

headline: trendy bar, so-so food
content: It's the trendy place to visit while in Key West, so you probably should check it out, just to say you did. The food is really just so-so, but the prices aren't too bad for Key West. The nachos were good, the so called "Philly...More

headline: Another great bar....
content: Sloppy Joe's was our first stop when we got into Key West. The food was good, and the drinks were even better. The bartenders took excellent care of us (thanks Keith!) and the transformation from day to night brings an open dancefloor, and a band...More

headline: A Key West Must See!
content: Had lunch here on a nice sunny afternoon. Service was fast and friendly, food was good and reasonably priced (for Key West) and it was fun to sit at a table by the street and watch the crowds go by. The bartender was even nice...More

headline: Wish you were here!
content: Sloppy Joe's was everything we expected and more. The drinks were tasty, the people watching priceless (both inside and out), and the live entertainment festive... but the best part was the live streaming web-cam out front. Send the ultimate new-age postcard. Call home and tell...More

headline: The Ultimate Key West Experience
content: The must see bar/restaurant in Key West!  The food and drinks are served in a cool, island atmosphere.  Add to it the live music and this will be a favorite stop on your vacation.
